title: Tax Internship
description:
**Company Overview:** *Maestro Financial Solutions has rebranded as Trove. Check out* *trove.net* *for more information.*


Trove is an administrative financial services company that understands the complex needs of high-net-worth individuals, families and/or their organizations. Trove delivers an array of bespoke, day-to-day, financial solutions to the clients and engagements it serves. We have 5 office locations: Boston, MA; New York City, NY; Bryn Mawr, PA; Salt Lake City, UT; and Stamford, CT. Through continued growth we have become the leading independent multi-family office in North America! At Trove we are dedicated to building centers of excellence with a trusted, innovative, and expert team to support our clients and engagements. We look for talented people who are motivated, curious, collaborative, and have a passion for delivering the highest quality services with a culture of teamwork. Interested? Read more about the day-to-day responsibilities of our Tax Intern!


**What We Do**

The tax department serves as a family’s controller and tax advisor, collecting and structuring their transaction data, advising them on tax and estate matters and reporting on investment performance and allocations.


**Internship Program**


We have an exciting opportunity for students looking to gain hands on accounting and tax experience. This position will work directly with the tax department to help meet various client deadlines during the upcoming tax season. The internship will take place during the Spring 2025 semester from January to April in our Stamford, CT office. While working under several accounting and tax professionals, our interns will receive hands on training to ensure they have a valuable experience to help launch their careers. This is a paid internship position, with the ability to receive college credit if needed. No tax experience required!


**Learning Objectives:**


* Understand the various types of tax filings (1040s, 1065s, 1120S, etc.)
* Be able to identify tax forms and know their purpose (W-2s, 1099s, etc.)
* Effectively communicate with staff and management in a professional manner
* Utilize and learn the tax software for return preparation
* Build foundational knowledge of tax matters to fast-track your career advancement from preparer to advisor


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Prepare 1099s for a variety of business clients
* Review and organize client files into excel and PDF tax workpapers
* Assist with the preparation of U.S. Individual Income Tax Returns
* Work with staff and partners on various task specific projects
* Administrative tasks such as opening client mail and scanning to our tax software


**Qualifications:**


* Pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s in accounting or related field with a minimum GPA of 3.0
* Excellent attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
* Demonstrated skills in the areas of communication, interpersonal skills, relationship building, collaboration, and problem solving
* Highly motivated and takes initiative for professional growth and development
* Open to receiving constructive feedback
* Within commutable distance to work at least 20 hours a week in the Stamford, CT office

title: Technical Architect
description:
We have **long term contract role** for **Technical Architect** role for **Remote / Buffalo NY.**

**Role: Technical Architect**

**Location: Remote / Buffalo NY**

**Mandatory Skills:**

**Job Description:** 

**Duration:** Long term – 1 year

**Must haves:** Strong Architectural experience. PHP, Typescript, GCP – solid experience, need hands on experience.

**Summary:** Seeking a highly motivated individual who possesses strong leadership, technical and analytical skills, with an understanding of the wholesale brokerage insurance industry preferred. The individual is expected to understand requirements, identify appropriate designs, code to the design specifications to ensure a quality solution delivery. Effective collaboration with the business users, IT, and various stakeholders is required. Serves as mentor, advisor, and guide to the team of Developers, Sr Devs, Tech Leads.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Serve as a Architect to design, customize, and implement IT solutions for wholesale brokerage platforms within the organization.
* Maintains familiarity with new development tools and techniques for systems analysis, design, and development.
* Single point of contact for architecture, design, and development for existing stack of applications.
* Develop and review solution architecture, design, and code.
* Ability to review and rationally analyze requirements in a timely manner.
* Research and propose solutions for cloud data transformation, data connections, operational frameworks, and application integration.
* Work closely with lead architects and engineers to create and maintain architectural templates and build/operational documents.
* Work with DevOps and engineering teams to develop service catalogs.
* Lead a large team of Developers, Senior Developers, Tech Leads across various Tech stack.
* Develop an understanding of existing client IT applications while actively searching for improvement areas.
* Streamline workflows and process optimization by implementing inventive technical solutions.
* Engage with stakeholders, updating them on IT development processes and costs.
* Deep hands-on experience with multiple development approaches, pattern and architecture means to implement solution. Collaborating with their team to identify and fix technical problems.
* Work closely with business leads and product owners to understand solution requirements and identify architectural patterns.
* Evaluate existing tech stack and emerging technologies on a regular basis.
* Develop and implement ways to move applications and workloads to the cloud and modernize applications.
* Enhance cloud capability by creating and implementing cloud application patterns.
* Lead and guide development & support teams. Mentor team members. Technical/ functional guidance on the app
* Orchestrate work prioritization, scheduling, and allocation for the rest of the Service Provider team.

**Required Skills**

* Familiarity with a variety of both legacy and modern coding languages, frameworks, and patterns. MUST Have: **Typescript, PHP, XML, NodeJS, Postgres, PubSub, GCP and Azure Cloud, MicroServices, APIs.** Good To HAVE: Experience of .Net, SQL, T-SQL, MongoDB, and Java.
* Solid experience working in Agile environment. Both Scrum and Kanban.
* Solid Understanding of Web applications, cloud managed services, service-oriented architecture (SOA) solutions, microservices, containers, API development and managed databases
* Hands on experience designing and developing new features.
* Superior analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Proven ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
* Hands on experience with Jira, Confluence, Service Now, ITIL tools and process framework
* Experience presenting and interacting with CXO Level executives.

**Required Education/Experience**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or Computer Science
* 18+ years professional development and applications architecture experience

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $60.00 - $65.00 per hour

Experience:

* Software development: 10 years (Preferred)

Work Location: On the road

title: Plant Human Resources Manager
description:
We heard you knock!
Masonite is now proudly part of Owens Corning. Owens Corning is a global building and construction materials leader committed to building a sustainable future through material innovation. Our four integrated businesses – Roofing, Insulation, Doors, and Composites – provide durable, sustainable, energy-efficient solutions that leverage our unique material science, manufacturing, and market knowledge to help our customers win and grow. We are global in scope, human in scale with more than 25,000 employees in 31 countries dedicated to generating value for our customers and shareholders, and making a difference in the communities where we work and live. Founded in 1938 and based in Toledo, Ohio, USA, Owens Corning posted 2023 sales of $9.7 billion. For more information, visit www.owenscorning.com.  

Overview
The Plant Human Resources Manager acts as a key consultant and advisor to plant management on HR issues at their plant.
Responsibilities* Act as a key consultant and advisor to management on Human Resource issues by identifying problem areas, proposing solutions to correct any issues, and executing those solutions in a timely manner.
* Ensure all members of management apply all policies and regulations in a consistent manner by performing periodic audits of employee related actions.
* Administer the Collective Bargaining Agreement to ensure adherence to negotiated issues.
* Foster positive Union Management relationships as the Company lead for labor relations issues
* Assist all members of management in communicating expected goals and objectives to their direct reports and involve all employees in decision-making processes in which they can have a direct positive impact.
* Manage the recruitment process for all hiring, for both internal and external job postings, in consultation with the management team; provide onboarding and orientations as required; devise retention strategies for all employees and complete exit interviews.
* Ensure all governmental and regulatory requirements are met by maintaining accurate records, submit all reports in a timely manner and insisting that all employees follow the required legal guidelines without deviation.
* Drive the Masonite performance management and leadership training processes throughout the facilities
* Ensure planning, monitoring and appraisal of employee work results by training managers to coach and discipline employees
* Maintain the work structure by updating job descriptions for all positions.
* Create, revise and develop policies and procedures as necessary and ensure that all communications surrounding these policies are clear and documented
* Work with the EHS Manager to manage all work related or non-work related leave of absence cases, claims, and the coordination of the RTW process when necessary
* Manage and administer the attendance management program
* Work closely with Payroll & Benefits to ensure compliance with all payroll and benefits related issues.
* Ensure that all levels of management and employees follow and adhere to the principles and values of the Masonite blueprint
* Perform any other duties or participate in special projects as assigned by the RHRM.


Qualifications* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or related field preferred.
* 3 to 5 years of experience in Human Resources Management in a manufacturing environment.
* 3 years of labor relations experience in a Union environment is required.
* Ability to objectively coach employees and management through issues that may be complex, difficult and emotional.
* Must have the ability to make recommendations to effectively resolve problems or issues by using judgment that is consistent with standards, practices, policies, procedures, regulations or government law.
* Ability to organize and prioritize work.
* Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills.
* Bilingual - Spanish a plus.


#LI-DB1 #ONSITE  

We Help People Walk Through Walls
We respect the privacy of candidates for employment. Our *Masonite Applicant Privacy Policy* sets forth in more detail our privacy practices, including, without limitation, our collection and usage practices, of your personal information when you apply for a position with a Masonite entity.

title: Teen Advisor
description:
**Salary: $17.52 Hourly**  

  

The YMCA of Greater New York is here for all New Yorkers — to empower youth, improve health, and strengthen community. Founded in 1852, today the Y serves a diverse population of more than half a million New Yorkers who learn, grow, and thrive through programs and services at our 24 branches. Community is the cornerstone of the Y. Together, we connect active, engaged New Yorkers to build stronger communities.  

To help fulfill our mission, we cultivate a culture of learning, leading, and collaboration to enhance community impact. Through our talented staff and “LEAP” career framework (Leadership, Empowerment, Accountability, Personal Growth), we are committed to a people-first approach that fosters trust, inclusion, growth, and development for all.  


The Vanderbilt YMCA is seeking Teen Advisors. Under the supervision of the Teen Coordinator, the Teen Advisor will play a critical role in the successful operation of the teen programs. The Teen Advisor will lead and supervise all teen services and programs, including Y Saturday Night Programs. The Teen Advisor will also be responsible for advertising and recruiting participants, ensuring proper documentation and reporting, and meeting program outcome goals and deliverables.  

  

Program Portfolio: Y Saturday Night Lights (SNL), Y Scholars, Teens Take the City (TTC), Rowe Scholars, Leaders Club, and Teen Center.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:*** Ensure the health, safety, and well-being of participants in the program by providing close supervision of all activities and ensuring spaces are clean and supplies are well maintained.
* Plan, create, and facilitate lesson plans for all programs.
* Manage administrative data entry in various systems, including Youth Service.NET, coordinate participant paperwork, conduct program surveys, and meet all other requirements outlined by City agencies and the YMCA’s Teen Standards.
* Must be able to manage adolescent behavior with respect, maturity, compassion, and encouragement.
* Develop positive relationships with the participants, their friends, and family members.
* Lead programming with a focus on Social Emotional Learning and skill development.
* Ability to work cooperatively with professional staff and other departments.
* Create an environment that is diverse, culturally sensitive, and relevant to the needs of teens.
* Actively participate in designated meetings, training sessions, and special events.
* Adhere to all Department of Health, YMCA of Greater New York, and funder standards, expectations, and regulations.

 **Desired Skills & Experience:*** High School diploma or equivalent required. College credits preferred.
* Minimum of one (1) year of experience working with pre-teens and teens (ages 13 and older).
* General knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Knowledge of Access, Adobe PageMaker, and Photoshop preferred.
* Strong interpersonal skills, leadership qualities, and comfortable working with diverse youth and adults.

  

**Benefits:**  

The YMCA of Greater New York offers a variety of benefits to its staff members, including retirement benefits, medical, paid time off, free YMCA membership, and more! Benefit eligibility is determined by an individual’s employment status (i.e., full-time or part-time), tenure, and/or the number of hours scheduled to work. Click here for more information.  

  

**How to Apply:**
If you would like to be a member of our dynamic team, please complete our online application and submit your résumé and a thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest in the role and our organization.

If you are a current YMCA employee, please submit your application through the Internal Career Site in Cornerstone.

title: Retail Distribution Center Rep.
description:
American Dream, developed by Triple Five Group, is an unparalleled mix of world-class entertainment, retail, and dining, comprising more than 3 million square feet just minutes away from New York City in East Rutherford, New Jersey. American Dream is home to leading attractions, including DreamWorks Water Park, Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park, LEGOLAND Discovery Center, SEA LIFE Aquarium, Big SNOW Ski Hill, Dream Wheel – a 300-foot observation wheel overlook the NYC skyline,
  
as well as attractions debuting soon such as The Game Room Powered by Hasbro and Skip Barber Racing Go-Kart Academy. American Dream’s immersive luxury shopping and dining experience – The Avenue – features Saks Fifth Avenue, Hermès, Saint Laurent, Dolce & Gabbana, Carpaccio, a fine-dining Italian restaurant, and much more. The retail collection is further expanded with flagship locations for Aritzia, H&M, PRIMARK, Uniqlo, Sephora and Zara; as well as the Toys'R'Us global flagship, the only standalone location in the U.S, and the world’s first and only “candy department store,” IT’SUGAR.
  
For more information on American Dream, visit www.americandream.com or find us on Instagram @americandream and TikTok @americandream\\_official.
  
KEY OBJECTIVE(S)
  
**The main purpose of the Retail Distribution Center Support is:**
  
* To assist in the accurate receipt of goods from vendors into the DC and distribute or set up all product in a timely manner to various locations throughout the Entertainment Retail Center (ERC).


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
  
* Ensure accuracy in completion of all warehouse receiving documents for entry into the computer system.
* Communicate and verify all discrepancies.
* Open the boxes, separate the product out by which location it goes to.
* Count product and fill out accompanying paperwork needed for second stage receiving and organize product according to its required destination.
* Apply price tags to all product.
* Bin product in proper locations in the distribution center.
* Rotation of stock to make sure the oldest product is used first in order to prevent expiration of the items.
* Re-organizing existing items in the warehouse to make room for new items and large shipments or to prioritize the items according to need.
* Perform inventories and Cycle Counts
* Quality control (checking for damaged product)
* Deliver product to the correct locations throughout the ERC.
* Adhere to all safety policies to ensure personal safety, the safety of guests and fellow coworkers
* Maintain the cleanliness of the Warehouse.
* Ability to understand a planogram for design layout.
* Other duties as assigned.


DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
  
* Must be at least 18 years of age
* High School diploma or equivalent preferred
* 1-2 years previous warehouse experience preferred
* Basic Computer skills required
* Must be extremely organized
* Must possess good math/counting skills
* Must have outstanding written/verbal communication
* Must have retail/merchandising knowledge


American Dream is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment or discrimination. All employment decisions are to be made without regard to race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, pregnancy, national origin/ancestry, citizenship, physical/mental disability, military status or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Assistant Teacher I
description:
**Salary: $17.34 Hourly**  

  

The YMCA of Greater New York is here for all New Yorkers — to empower youth, improve health, and strengthen community. Founded in 1852, today the Y serves a diverse population of more than half a million New Yorkers who learn, grow, and thrive through programs and services at our 24 branches. Community is the cornerstone of the Y. Together, we connect active, engaged New Yorkers to build stronger communities.  

  

To help fulfill our mission, we cultivate a culture of learning, leading, and collaboration to enhance community impact. Through our talented staff and “LEAP” career framework (Leadership, Empowerment, Accountability, Personal Growth), we are committed to a people-first approach that fosters trust, inclusion, growth, and development for all.  

  

The Flatbush YMCA is seeking an Assistant Teacher who will support the Head Group Teacher/Group Teacher in implementing lesson plans and classroom activities, parent/family engagement, classroom management, and adherence to all internal and external policies and procedures.  

  

The Early Childhood Program operates Monday through Friday, from September 1, 2024, through June 30, 2025.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Ensure the health, safety, and well-being of children in the program by providing close supervision of all activities.
* Assist the Head Group Teacher/Group Teacher with implementing developmentally appropriate lessons and activities, including, but not limited to, literacy, arts, math, cooking, science, outdoor/indoor recreation, field trips, etc.
* Guide students in their academic growth.
* Actively communicate with and engage parents and families.
* Work as a supportive team member within the Early Childhood Learning Center and the YMCA Branch.
* Maintain a clean and safe classroom environment by reporting and/or removing all potential hazards and by setting up spaces and materials with a focus on supporting child learning.
* Prepare food for children and maintain a family-style eating environment conducive to language, cognitive, and social development and the development of healthy habits.
* Maintain accurate program documentation, including, but not limited to, incident/accident/behavior reports, attendance sheets, sign-in/sign-out sheets, development/growth forms, documentation of eating and sleeping, parent surveys, etc.
* Maintain equipment, storage, and supply inventory, as needed.
* Ensure that all YMCA of Greater New York, Department of Health, and Department of Education (if applicable) guidelines are followed.
* Actively participate in designated meetings, all training sessions, and special events.

 **Desired Skills & Experience:**

* High School diploma/GED and/or a study plan. Teacher Assistant certificate preferred.
* Minimum of one (1) year of experience working with young children in a group setting.
* Knowledge of child development and developmentally appropriate practices.

 **Benefits:**  

The YMCA of Greater New York offers a variety of benefits to its staff members, including retirement benefits, medical, paid time off, free YMCA membership, and more! Benefit eligibility is determined by an individual’s employment status (i.e., full-time or part-time), tenure, and/or the number of hours scheduled to work. Click here for more information.  

  

**How to Apply:**  

If you would like to be a member of our dynamic team, please complete our online application and submit your résumé and a thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest in the role and our organization.  

  

If you are a current YMCA employee, please submit your application through the Internal Career Site in Cornerstone.

title: Director, Procurement & Vendor Governance
description:
Job Summary  

The Director of Procurement & Vendor Governance has overall ownership of the policies and process around governing Otsuka’s vendor management practices, driving procurement efficiencies and ensuring compliance with established procurement policies. This individual will partner closely with sourcing, business partners and vendors to ensure vendor contractual compliance, procurement policy compliance and driving efficiencies across a combination of onshore and offshore processes. This role is responsible for the development and governance of the company’s overall Purchasing Program. This role enforces all policies, processes, and systems related to purchasing in OAPI/OPDC, and partners with other key Sourcing stakeholders in Supply Chain, R&D, Regional (OAI), and with our parent company in Japan.
Job Description* Develop and implement procurement policies, procedures, and standards to govern the buying practices at Otsuka. This will include all purchasing policies and include establishing policies around the selection, evaluation, and oversight of vendors.
* Collaborate with procurement, legal, finance, and other departments to ensure procurement management policies align with organizational goals and regulatory requirements.
* Establish vendor qualification criteria, performance metrics, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure vendor performance and adherence to contractual agreements. Work with Sourcing and Legal to ensure these are embedded in contractual documentation.
* Conduct periodic reviews and audits of vendor relationships to assess compliance with policies, contractual terms, and service level agreements (SLAs). This may also include examining financial data.
* Identify potential risks associated with vendor relationships and develop strategies to mitigate risks, including contingency plans and alternative sourcing options.
* Provide guidance and support to internal stakeholders on processes, including vendor selection, negotiation, contract management and buying.
* Stays knowledgeable of industry trends, best practices, and regulatory developments related to procurement management, and recommend updates to policies and procedures as necessary.
* Foster strong relationships with key vendors, promoting collaboration, transparency, and continuous improvement in vendor performance and service delivery.
* Serve as a subject matter expert on vendor management policies and procedures, providing training and guidance to employees involved in vendor-related activities.


Qualifications/ Required
Knowledge/ Experience and Skills:
Knowledge* Experience and proven success in establishing procurement policies.
* Demonstrated knowledge on building out dashboarding and metrics that evaluate performance
* Extensive knowledge in the development, ongoing monitoring and reporting of KPIs as part of a vendor program
* Experience in auditing contracts, understanding financial implication of contracts and evaluating vendor control environments
* Strong experience with senior stakeholder management with the ability to collaboratively co-develop strategies and set and manage expectations of senior leadership
* Experience working in a Sourcing/Procurement team in a complex environment
* Strong communication skills required; must have the ability to communicate effectively
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to independently manage and prioritize workload
* Demonstrate a positive attitude and have an appetite for change
* Business degree or equivalent
* Experience interacting with senior level clients and vendors; able to evaluate situations from multiple angles and sensitive to stakeholders needs while maintaining focus on bring the best value to the organization
* Understands key financial and operational controls needed in a Procurement organization in the Pharmaceutical industry.


Skills and Experience  

Minimum of 10+ years of Vendor Management experience including the ability to strategize and lead.* Proven experience in vendor management, procurement, or supply chain management, with a focus on policy development and implementation.
* Strong understanding of vendor management principles, purchasing processes, and best practices, including vendor selection, evaluation, and performance management.
* Superior leadership skills with demonstrated success in team development
* Excellent analytical skills with the ability to assess vendor and procurement performance, identify risks, and develop risk mitigation strategies.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships with vendors and internal stakeholders.
* Demonstrated leadership ability with experience leading cross-functional teams and driving results in a matrixed organization.
* Knowledge of relevant regulatory requirements and industry standards related to vendor management.
* Proficiency in vendor management software and tools for contract management, performance tracking, and risk assessment. SAP Ariba a plus.
* Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and execute initiatives within budgetary constraints.
* Commitment to continuous learning and professional development in the field of vendor management and supply chain operations.


 Education  

Bachelor's degree in Business, Supply Chain, or relevant technical expertise. Advanced degree (MBA/MS) preferred.  

Competencies  

Accountability for Results - Stay focused on key strategic objectives, be accountable for high standards of performance, and take an active role in leading change.  

Strategic Thinking & Problem Solving - Make decisions considering the long-term impact to customers, patients, employees, and the business.  

Patient & Customer Centricity - Maintain an ongoing focus on the needs of our customers and/or key stakeholders.  

Impactful Communication - Communicate with logic, clarity, and respect. Influence at all levels to achieve the best results for Otsuka.  

Respectful Collaboration - Seek and value others’ perspectives and strive for diverse partnerships to enhance work toward common goals.  

Empowered Development - Play an active role in professional development as a business imperative.
Come discover more about Otsuka and our benefit offerings; https://www.otsuka-us.com/careers-join-otsuka.
Disclaimer:  

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by the people assigned to this position. It is not intended to include every job duty and responsibility specific to the position. Otsuka reserves the right to amend and change responsibilities to meet business and organizational needs as necessary.  

Otsuka is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will be given consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, religion, national origin, veteran status, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic.  

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation, if you are unable or limited in your ability to apply to this job opening as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by contacting Accommodation Request.
Statement Regarding Job Recruiting Fraud Scams
At Otsuka we take security and protection of your personal information very seriously. Please be aware individuals may approach you and falsely present themselves as our employees or representatives. They may use this false pretense to try to gain access to your personal information or acquire money from you by offering fictitious employment opportunities purportedly on our behalf.
Please understand, Otsuka will never ask for financial information of any kind or for payment of money during the job application process. We do not require any financial, credit card or bank account information and/or any payment of any kind to be considered for employment. We will also not offer you money to buy equipment, software, or for any other purpose during the job application process. If you are being asked to pay or offered money for equipment fees or some other application processing fee, even if claimed you will be reimbursed, this is not Otsuka. These claims are fraudulent and you are strongly advised to exercise caution when you receive such an offer of employment.
Otsuka will also never ask you to download a third-party application in order to communicate about a legitimate job opportunity. Scammers may also send offers or claims from a fake email address or from Yahoo, Gmail, Hotmail, etc, and not from an official Otsuka email address. Please take extra caution while examining such an email address, as the scammers may misspell an official Otsuka email address and use a slightly modified version duplicating letters.
To ensure that you are communicating about a legitimate job opportunity at Otsuka, please only deal directly with Otsuka through its official Otsuka Career website https://vhr-otsuka.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/External.
Otsuka will not be held liable or responsible for any claims, losses, damages or expenses resulting from job recruiting scams. If you suspect a position is fraudulent, please contact Otsuka’s call center at: 800-363-5670. If you believe you are the victim of fraud resulting from a job recruiting scam, please contact the FBI through the Internet Crime Complaint Center at: https://www.ic3.gov, or your local authorities.
Otsuka America Pharmaceutical Inc., Otsuka Pharmaceutical Development & Commercialization, Inc., and ODH, Inc. (“Otsuka”) does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs/resumes submitted by search firms to any Otsuka employee directly or through Otsuka’s application portal without a valid written search agreement in place for the position will be considered Otsuka’s sole property. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired by Otsuka as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

title: Maintenance Associates, Rockefeller Center
description:
**Company Description** **OUR STORY**


Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands. We restlessly seek what is next for maximizing life - and boldly grow the lifestyle brands and experiences that define it. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, **Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Equinox Hotels and Equinox Media** are all recognized for inspiring and motivating members and employees to maximize life. Our portfolio of brands is recognized globally with locations within every major city across the United States in addition to London, Toronto, and Vancouver.

**OUR CODE**


We are passionate about **high performance living** and we practice what we preach – investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them and it takes a **disruptive approach** to unleash it. We **dream big** and don’t settle for the status quo. We **sweat the details**. We never accept less than **110%** to **help each other** deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results. We are obsessed with what’s new, what’s now, **what’s next**. Never following, always leading, living ahead of the moment in fashion, culture and consumer behavior. We aren’t just a company; we’re a community vested in each other’s success. We value **humility** and a **team approach** at every level of the company.


If you are a high performing individual who is passionate about winning and inspiring others then we are excited to discuss career opportunities with you.

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for energetic, creative, and enthusiastic **Mainatenance Associates** to join the Equinox team at **Rockefeller Center .**

**Job responsibilities include but are not limited to the following**:

* Ensure that the Male locker rooms are clean, stocked and well maintained while providing all members, prospective members, and guests with excellent customer service
* Clean and organize storage, laundry, exercise, and coat rooms
* Maintain an adequate supply of towels in the male locker room
* Assist with special events
* Notify the Maintenance Manager when any rooms need immediate attention

  

**Qualifications** **The successful candidate must have the following experience, skills, and education:**

* Must possess a clear understanding of what constitutes a clean and sanitary environment
* Ability to service athletic equipment along with previous experience working with cleaning products and hand tools
* Strong customer service, organizational, communication, and multi-tasking abilities


Pay Transparency: $16/hr

 **Additional Information** **AS A MEMBER OF THE EQUINOX TEAM YOU WILL RECEIVE:**

* We offer competitive salary, benefits, and industry leading commission opportunities for club employees
* Complimentary Club membership
* Perks and incentives with our products and services including Personal Training, Pilates, Spa and Shop


This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.

**Equinox is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at** ***https://careers.equinox.com/***


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in the United States.

title: Veterinary Assistant ER/ICU (Nights and Weekend Shifts) - Immediate
company: Veterinary Surgical Center of Long Island ("VSCLI")
description:
**Veterinary Assistant – Nights/Weekends**

**Job description/Overview**

**Veterinary Surgical Center of Long Island (“VSCLI”)** is seeking an experienced **Veterinary Assistant** to join our Team. This position will have an opportunity to work in our **Surgery Department as well as ER/ICU.** We are hiring for **OVERNIGHT** and **WEEKEND** shifts in our hospital.

VSCLI is a Specialty Referral Practice and a 24-Hour Emergency Care Hospital in Huntington, NY. Our brand-new 10,000 square-foot state-of-the-art hospital opened its doors in April 2024. VSCLI’s specialty services are focused on Emergency Medicine and Surgery. VSCLI is seeking a **Veterinary Assistant** to join our Team, and assist us in rapidly growing our specialty referral practice and 24-hour emergency hospital.

VSCLI is looking for a highly skilled **Veterinary Assistant** who is dedicated to delivering the highest quality of medicine to our patients and thrives in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate must be professional, compassionate, dedicated, enthusiastic, conscientious, positive, motivated, and communicates well with colleagues, staff, and clients. We are focused on a healthy environment that will provide for professional fulfillment and personal happiness.

The ideal candidate will have the opportunity to join a collaborative and dedicated group that receives cases from a loyal referral community that desires the best care for the patient. A typical day would include surgery admissions, treatment of hospitalized pets, performing in clinic blood work as well as preparing samples for off-site labs, file documentation & invoicing, assisting with appointments, filling prescriptions, performing technician appointments, surgery prep, assisting in surgery, client call backs, surgery discharge and inventory management.

VSCLI is privately owned and strives to be the country’s premier surgical and emergency care hospital. We are progressive, team-oriented, and practice high-quality surgery, medicine, communication, and compassionate patient care. Our **state-of-the-art hospital** is equipped with a Canon 128 slice CT, Magnetic Resonance Imaging, 2 digital radiology rooms, ultrasound, laboratory, and Snyder oxygen cage.

**Duties & Responsibilities**

· Provide assistance to veterinarians and credentialed technicians with appointments, prepping patients for surgery and minor procedures, surgical assisting, and pro-actively set up for any procedures or diagnostic tests

· Maintain patient cleanliness

· Responsible for cleaning, feeding and care of animals in surgery, ICU, and in isolation areas.

· Responsible for accurate & timely data entry regarding patient vitals, medical status, urination, bowel movements

· Provide patient restraint in a safe, efficient, and caring manner

· Obtain accurate vitals, obtain medical histories, and/or note any changes of patient’s condition to DVM Feeding patients

· Collect and prepare laboratory samples such as fecal, urine, and ear cytologies

· Care and maintenance of all medical equipment including laboratory machines, surgical packs, anesthesia machines, and any other tools that are essential to daily operations

· High quality client communication on patient updates and questions

· Walking patients

· Comforting patients

· Cleaning

· Client interactions

· Record documentation

· IV catheterization

· On-call opportunities

**Position Knowledge & Skill Requirements**

* Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
* Strong interpersonal & communication skills
* Meticulous to detail & organized

· Must possess strong communication skills, good judgment and be able to manage stressful situations, and work with others on a team respectfully

· Display tact, professionalism, and diplomacy with clients, VSCLI personnel, and fellow team members

* Interact intelligibly and pleasantly with clients and staff
* Possess a strong attention to detail
* Flexibility with assigned tasks which will change depending on which service you are working with.
* Applicant must be flexible and able to work any area of the hospital
* Professional & reliable

**Position Qualifications**

· High School Diploma (or equivalent) or above

· Veterinary Assistant 1 year or more (preferred)

· Veterinary experience 1 year or more (preferred)

· Must be a TEAM PLAYER

· Minimum 1-3 years of experience

· Knowledge of basic veterinary medical terminology

· Animal handling and restraint

· Ability to lift 40 pounds

· Ability to use a computer.

**Reports To:** VSCLI Practice Manager

**More About Us**

VSCLI is located in the beautiful town of Huntington, NY. We are on the north shore of Long Island in a harbor town, rich with outdoor activities and delicious culturally diverse restaurants. Huntington is an amazing place to live and work. Within our town, are parks, museums, theater, fine dining, public library, schools, the harbor, golfing courses, and stores for all needs. We are 60 minutes from New York City by car or the Long Island Rail Road.

VSCLI is seeking the very best veterinary practitioners to staff our new hospital in all positions. VSCLI’s mission of delivering the best surgical and emergency care to its patients will be realized by assembling a Team who uphold its core values of Excellence, Integrity, Professionalism and Teamwork.

VSCLI offers a competitive salary and benefits which include: health insurance (medical, dental, and vision), 401K, and paid time off.

VSCLI is an equal opportunity employer and a drug-free workplace.

**Interested candidates should email their resume and cover letter to career@vscli.com and include the desired position title in the email subject line.**

title: Administrative Assistant to Vice President of Operations
description:
**Administrative Assistant to VP of Operations - Cloud & Business Optimization**

Do you thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where you can contribute to significant growth and innovation? Are you highly organized and detail-oriented, passionate about technology and operational efficiency? If so, we want to hear from you!

**Position Overview**: Manufacturers Edge, Inc. seeks a highly organized and detail-oriented Administrative Assistant to support our VP of Operations in driving our strategic initiatives and ensuring seamless operations across our cloud-based applications, business processes, and internal systems. This crucial role requires a proactive individual who can handle multiple tasks simultaneously and thrives in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate will possess strong organizational and time management skills and a proven track record of providing exceptional administrative support in an executive setting.

**Responsibilities:**

* Calendar Management & Communication: Provide high-level administrative support to the VP of Operations, including managing calendars, scheduling meetings, coordinating travel arrangements, handling email correspondence, filing, and data entry.
* Project Coordination: Offer administrative support for project implementations, integrations, and updates related to cloud applications, CRM systems, and other technology initiatives. Act as a liaison between the VP of Operations and internal/external vendors/customers/contractors.
* Business Process Enhancement & Optimization: Document, analyze, and streamline business processes to contribute to efficiency gains and cost reductions.
* SOP & Script Development: Contribute to creating, maintaining, and implementing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and scripts for various operational tasks.
* Reporting & Data Analysis: Gather, compile, and analyze data for reports on key operational metrics related to inventory, sales, logistics, and customer interactions using Salesforce or NetSuite for data management and reporting.
* Inventory Management: Assist with inventory tracking, reconciliation, and reporting to optimize stock and ensure accurate data.
* Logistics & Fulfillment: Support logistics operations, including order processing, shipment tracking, and vendor communication.
* E-commerce & Sales Operations: Provide administrative support for e-commerce platforms, including order processing, customer service inquiries, and sales data analysis.
* HR & Administration: Assist with administrative tasks related to HR, including onboarding, training, and employee records management.
* Workflow & Automation: Contribute to developing and implementing workflows and automation initiatives to enhance efficiency and reduce manual tasks.
* AI & Technology Integration: Stay updated on emerging technologies, particularly AI and cloud-based solutions, and identify potential applications within the company.
* IT Support: Assist with IT-related tasks, including software installations, troubleshooting, and communication with IT personnel.
* Perform other duties to support the VP of Operations and the executive team.
* Manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize effectively to meet deadlines.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as an executive assistant or in a similar role supporting C-level executives.
* Experience with CRM systems, cloud platforms, and business process documentation tools.
* Exceptional organizational and time-management skills.
* Strong attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with correspondents.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Ability to juggle multiple tasks and projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
* Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, including data analysis, pivot tables, and complex formulas.
* Adaptability and willingness to learn new technologies and systems.
* Discretion and confidentiality in handling sensitive information.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work in a dynamic and growing company.-
* Collaborative and inclusive work environment.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.

**Bonus Points:**

* Experience with Salesforce, NetSuite, or other cloud-based platforms.
* Knowledge of basic programming concepts and scripting languages.
* Experience with AI or data analytics tools.

This is an outstanding opportunity for a highly organized and proactive individual to make a real impact on a rapidly growing company. We encourage you to apply if you’re passionate about technology, efficiency, and contributing to a dynamic team!

**To Apply:** Please submit your resume and cover letter to [agnes@pumpcatalog.com]

We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: LINDBERGH Store Manager
description:
\\*\\*Urgently hiring

LINDBERGH is a men’s fashion brand that provides a solution to modern fashion  
in timeless & authentic styles, designed as modern wardrobe staples and long-lasting quality in mind : we welcome excellent individuals to join us!

**Full Job Description**

As a Store Manager at LINDBERGH, you’ll be responsible for successfully managing all store operations tasks in order to maximize sales results. You will be a mentor, role model, and coach for your team members. You will lead your team by example, demonstrating how to deliver excellent customer service with a high degree of professionalism in order to provide a world-class shopping experience to customers. You will take ownership for the successful execution of all day-to-day merchandising, operations and service management tasks. You are ultimately responsible for the overall success of your store location and the associates on your team.

**Job Type**  
Full-time

**Experience & Skills**

* **Proven successful experience as a retail manager**
* Analysis Skills.
* Strong organizational skills.
* Good communication and interpersonal skills.
* Point of Sale systems, computer proficiency.
* Loss prevention and cash management.
* Scheduling and payroll management.
* Must be able to multi-task.
* Decision-making.
* Proficient in math and possesses strong computer skills.
* Proven ability to drive sales results in a high sales volume environment.
* Passion for product, brands, fashion and trends

***Responsibilities:***

* To ensure an excellent level of customer service is provided in the store.
* To lead and motivate the team, ensuring the development of staff potential.
* Ensure store team members are fulfilling their individual responsibilities.
* Facilitate onboarding and training for new associates, provide ongoing coaching in the moment, and implement structured learning and development activities for all team members.
* Maintain outstanding store condition and visual merchandising standards
* Deal with all issues that arise from staff or customers (complaints, grievances etc)
* Report on buying trends, customer needs, sales.
* To be familiar with the collection, and control and manage the stock to maximize sales.
* Proven ability to drive sales results in a high sales volume environment.
* To plan, organize, priorities and distribute tasks, optimizing resources and minimizing costs

***Schedule:***

* Day shift
* Holidays
* Night shift
* Weekend availability

***Additional Requirements***

* Flexibility of schedule and hours to meet the needs of the business.
* Valid driver’s license.

Job Summary:

Commercial Building Area Manager (Janitorial Services) OneService is looking for an experienced Area Manager to organize and oversee the operations of a number of Supervisors. You will assume responsibility for the overall success of our service delivery and customer satisfaction by setting targets, managing service staff, and ensuring they are meeting OneService expectations. The ideal Area Manager for OneService has prior experience in managing a large staff of cleaners/maintenance employees and instills the highest standard of service to our clientele. They must have meticulous attention to detail, is proactive, and hits the ground running in all facets of the business responsibilities. Shifts are Monday-Friday with an understanding that they have to be flexible with their hours and will require some weekend work. The position requires the following, non-negotiable characteristics:

* Precision and accuracy in the performance of all duties.
* Direct, articulate and succinct communication style, both verbal and written.
* Mastery of organizational skills, including management of multiple tasks and deadlines.
* Analysis of issues with a methodical and efficient, yet thorough, approach.
* Self-motivation to be proactive in identifying problems and developing recommended solutions.

title: Director, Marketing
description:
A marketing expert who will be responsible for establishing and implementing strategic and tactical communications plans designed to capitalize on market opportunities and generate demand. This role will oversee communications, consumer relationships, influencer and ambassador relationships, paid media, social media, and overall brand look, feel, and voice to ensure this goal. He/She/They will build a creative, integrated, multi-channel program that builds brand awareness and reputation, provides a steady flow of sales leads, and measures the return on marketing program investments. This role will report to the CMO and partner with other key stakeholders in the organization.
### **Description**


**The Role*** The Director of Marketing will be integral in leading and driving brand growth through 360marketing strategies. Think freely, and outside-the-box.
* Develop a comprehensive and aligned strategic marketing plan, calendar, and budget
* Understand and connect user segments to optimize communication channels, timing and messaging
* Concept, test and execute new programming
* Discover new technologies that can add value to the user journey and stay current on marketing trends
* Manage the creation and dissemination of all marketing collateral and sales support tools
* Manage partnership with key media agencies and external partners
* Partner with the team on all event execution, including but not limited to collaboration launches, pop-up activations, in-store events
* Leverage existing data and platforms to find largest opportunities; keep a focus on ROI but understand opportunities, risks and rewards.
* Develop and manage CRM, retention strategy and execution including email and text, app, in-store offline customers, referral programs, loyalty and new growth channels.
* Identify and improve LTV and engagement across all consumer channels through existing or new tools.
* Own VIP customer program to engage top consumers and community members – both online and in-store – work with store teams to disseminate VIP programming at B&M level as well
* Own brand messaging both internally and externally – speak to external contacts about upcoming initiatives and more traditional PR plays
* Oversee agencies and business partners
* Oversee team of marketing and creative staff

 **Desired Skills & Experience*** Minimum of 7 years of experience in fashion / lifestyle marketing.
* Ability to use left and right side of the brain. Think creatively and be open to try new things.
* Know how to base decisions on metrics and data.
* Creative with a good eye for design.
* Strong pulse on the industry, trends, new and upcoming technologies
* Proven track record of results-driven social media, PR and marketing for consumer products
* Proven excellence in team management, both direct team members and cross-functional
* Comfort in interacting with senior management
* Passion to build relationship with press and end-users via marketing vehicles
* Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Work smart. Know how to manage your time.
* Positive, curious attitude.
* Experience managing and hiring.
* Thinking outside of the box and building something new excites and motivates you.

  


#### **Salary**


$130,000 - $160,000 per year

title: HR & Admin Manager Bilingual Mandarin New York
description:
**HR & Administration Manager (Bilingual Mandarin)**

**About Us:**

American Chengyi Investment Management Group Inc. is a leading regional real estate development, investment, and management firm with a diverse portfolio of commercial and residential properties throughout metro New York City. We are seeking a proactive and skilled HR & Administration Manager to spearhead our administration team, ensuring full compliance with legal standards and company policies. This role, based at our headquarters in Great Neck, demands a strong on-site presence.

**Responsibilities:**

* **HR Management:** Oversee all aspects of HR recruitment, ADP payroll, and New York Workers’ Compensation Law compliance.
* **Administrative Duties:** Manage daily administrative and HR tasks, including payroll processing, benefits administration, leave management, and HRIS maintenance.
* **Policy and Compliance:** Review and update internal policies and procedures in accordance with legal requirements. Support compliance initiatives and handle internal/external audits as the primary contact. Ensure adherence to payroll and tax laws.
* **HR Systems:** Proficiently handle HRIS, TMS, payroll, employee relations, compensation and benefits, and compliance matters. Oversee payroll processing and generate reports for federal, state, and internal audits (monthly, quarterly, and year-end). Manage benefits, including Open Enrollment, and ensure 401(k) plan compliance. Administer Worktile and Leave Management.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with Finance and senior management on payroll reports and forecasts. Stay updated on labor legislation changes, employment insurance, and tax regulations. Perform ad-hoc duties as assigned by the CEO and CFO.
* **Recruitment and Onboarding:** Coordinate with department managers to ensure timely recruitment and effective onboarding of new hires.
* **Employee Evaluation:** Conduct year-end employee assessments and establish evaluation criteria based on performance data.
* **Strategic Input:** Provide HR strategy advice to the Board of Directors and contribute to overall management improvements.
* **Employee Engagement:** Foster open communication within the company to gather feedback and propose improvements. Promote company culture and enhance corporate cohesion.
* **External Relations:** Liaise with external headhunters, third-party administrative supervision companies, and other agencies for temporary employment or administrative needs.

**Position Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree required.
* Minimum of 6 years of experience in human resources and administrative roles.
* Strong understanding of modern HR management models, strategic planning, and operational skills.
* Excellent time management, organizational, and problem-solving abilities.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and ADP systems.
* Prior experience in the real estate industry preferred.
* Bilingual proficiency in English and Mandarin required.

If you are a dedicated HR professional with the expertise to manage a dynamic team and ensure compliance with complex regulations, we invite you to apply and join our team.

description:
THE BRAND

Banana Republic was founded with an explorer’s spirit and a desire to venture to new places, beyond the boundaries of the everyday. Our clothing is designed for a life with no boundaries. We travel near and far in search of the finest materials and fabric innovations to infuse style with substance, because we believe that what you wear should open a world of possibilities. And the people that make up Banana Republic share the same qualities as our brand: curious, connected, undaunted by boundaries. Sound like you? Join us for the adventure of what’s next.

THE ROLE As a Banana Republic stylist, you will help create aspirational and on trend looks that enhance the customer's emotional connection to the brand. You will be an expert on styling and fashion, with a thorough understanding of designers, brands and seasonal trends. As a stylist, you will contribute to a positive, friendly and inclusive environment that inspires and makes our customers feel welcome. Your goal is to grow the business by genuinely wanting to create an outstanding customer experience.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

* Connect and engage with customers authentically to understand their styling needs **Serve as a Brand storyteller to create experiences that drive sales and achieve store goals, with the customer as the primary focus**

Total Property Management (TPM), a service of AHRC Nassau, provides a full array of residential and commercial landscaping, including snow removal. The team leader supervises and participates in the work of a crew performing landscaping and horticultural functions. Available to work a varied schedule (including Saturdays) in sometimes adverse weather conditions.

**In addition, you will:**

* Show attention to detail and effectively communicates with subordinates, peers, and his/her supervisor.
* Load/fill gas cans, mowers, tools and necessary equipment. Secure all equipment.
* Check truck oil, fluids, tire pressure, proper trailer connection, and that all lights are in working condition.
* Manage and perform landscape installation and maintenance tasks on customers’ property.
* Work in conjunction with the TPM Coordinator to ensure the services required are implemented efficiently and according to the contract specifications.
* Manage and perform all tasks with spring operations including, but not limited to, leaf and debris removal, bed edging, and mulch installation.
* Provide “on the job” training of ground maintenance workers/ground maintenance assistants, so they are able to effectively and efficiently perform necessary tasks of all grounds maintenance services required.
* Hand pull weeds as necessary or sprays weed control if certified as an apprentice

**We require:**

* **High School Diploma or Equivalent**
* **Six (6) months of employment experience required**
* Good communication skills required
* Must be a qualified New York State driver with a good record required
* Basic understanding of mechanical and equipment maintenance required
* Ability to read, write and understand the English language at a level that permits to interact and communicate safely with porters, porters assistants, other staff members as well as keep open lines of communication with supervisors and customers.

**Schedule**: Monday - Friday 7am-3pm with flexibility (40 Hours). Available to work a varied schedule (including Saturdays) in sometimes adverse weather conditions.

**\\*Seasonal 10-month position March-December\\***

**Landscaping Team Leader, for immediate consideration, please send your resume to:**

title: Business Support Professional
description:
**Company Description**
-----------------------

**Business Support Professional, New York City**

**Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. No sponsorship is available for this position.**


Ramboll is seeking a full time Administrative Assistant for the New York City office.


We invite you to bring your administrative experience and people skills into play as you contribute to the day-to-day administrative operation and efficiency of our New York City office. To succeed in this role, you must have strong organization, communication, and document formatting skills, with attention to detail, and a collaborative style. The Administrative Assistant will have the responsibility to ensure that all levels of staff have the supplies and administrative support necessary to efficiently complete their work. The ideal candidate will be resourceful, self-motivated and have a professional presence for employees and visitors on a daily basis.


Do you want to push the boundaries of your profession and develop your excellence in an open, collaborative, and empowering culture? We work to create a sustainable future and our inspiring projects and innovative solutions strive to set the standard among our peers. You will join a global company that has been growing successfully since its founding in 1945. Together, we lead and leave a positive impact on societies, companies, and people around the world. Our mission is to create sustainable societies where people and nature flourish.

**You will join our New York City office**  

In joining Ramboll, you will be part of an internationally leading company within the area of water, environmental, and energy services. You will also become part of an administrative team that includes colleagues from other offices that work together to support the region and each other with business support requests in addition to local office responsibilities.

**Job Description**
-------------------

**Your key tasks and responsibilities will be**


Marketing Coordination

* Preparation of proposals and presentations using Microsoft Word, Adobe InDesign or PowerPoint that may include graphics and tables. (InDesign skills are beneficial but not required)
* Monitor client contracting, procurement, and purchasing portals
* Coordinate with the marketing department to maintain and update resumes, project sheets, and marketing material


Project Management Assistance

* Assist project managers with project setup using a CRM system, preparing invoices, and generating financial reports
* Project file management support using ProjectWise (ProjectWise experience is beneficial but not required)
* Document formatting and editing, reviewing for compliance with Ramboll branding standards, grammar, and punctuation
* Assist project teams with meeting scheduling, minutes, and as a point of contact for external proposal efforts


Office Administration

* Provide assistance receiving visitors and deliveries
* Maintain upkeep and appearance of the office and all supplies
* Onboarding / Offboarding employees, together with HR, including setting up laptops and monitors for new hires, issue guest badges and coordinate visitors
* Process vendor invoices for payment
* Employee and/or client event planning to include space negotiation, catering coordination, technical support for A/V and office equipment, set-up and clean-up of meeting space. This may include creating agendas and slides for internal presentations
* Work together with Workplace Management to manage the facilities
* Coordinate travel arrangements for consultants in the travel portal, if they need support
* Assist with maintaining office calendar and staff meeting coordination
* Coordinate with the safety team to maintain safety plan for office
**Qualifications**
------------------

**About You**  

From the moment you join Ramboll, we will support your personal and professional development so that you grow with the company. For this role, we believe your starting point is:

* 2 - 4 year college degree
* Minimum 5 years of administrative work experience or professional experience in marketing
* Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams) and Adobe Acrobat Pro
* Report and proposal formatting experience
* Excellent written and oral communication skills
* Professional and independent judgement surrounding internal and external client matters and communications
* Ease in working with diverse personalities and cultures, with flexible and active listening skills
* Detail oriented
* Ability to lift heavy objects (approx. 10 lbs)
**Additional Information**
--------------------------

**Ramboll in Americas**  

Ramboll has nearly 2,000 experts working across 50 offices in the Americas applying their passion to deliver innovative solutions within Environment & Health, Water, Energy and Planning & Urban Design. Founded in Denmark, Ramboll is a people company. We invite you to contribute to a sustainable future working in an open, collaborative, and empowering culture.


The salary range for this position in New York, NY is $56,264 to $70,331 DOE.

**How to apply**  

Apply online. Attach your CV, cover letter and relevant documents showcasing why you are the right fit for the role, and when you are available to start. We look forward to receiving your application.

**Additional Information**


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
company_description: Ramboll is a global engineering, architecture, and consultancy company with more than 18,000 experts who create sustainable solutions for clients all over the world.

At CMCS (Cardinal McCloskey Community Services), our mission is to protect, empower and promote independence for at-risk children and families and those with developmental disabilities through quality community based services.


The **Assistant Teacher** plays an important role in the lives of the children and families we support. Conducts home visits along with appropriate staff member.  **Education & Experience**

* Caring, upbeat personality.
* Child Development Associate Credential with specific Infant/ Toddler module or course work towards with active study plan to complete.
* Associates Degree in Early Childhood Education with 12 credits in infant/toddler development.
* Previous experience in a Head Start Program or other Early Childhood Setting.
* Two years' work experience meeting position competencies.

**Additional Requirements**

* Daily access to reliable transportation.
* Ability to pass and maintain acceptable record related to the mandated criminal background check process.
* Salary commensurate with experience.

  

CMCS offers excellent benefits package including medical, dental, vision, retirement plan, generous paid time off, flexible work schedules.


We encourage you to join our dedicated and diverse workforce by applying today!

title: HOUSEKEEPING MANAGER
description:
Summary


The Chatwal, a Luxury Collection Hotel located in the heart of Manhattan, The Chatwal bridges classic and contemporary like no other. Nestled between Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park and the Theater District, the landmark hotel originally built in 1905 by Stanford White, has been beautifully restored and renewed by master architect Thierry Despont, re-launched in 2010 with 76 rooms and suites, several of which features spacious terraces. Carefully selected amenities, professional butler service and bespoke service make it an ideal choice for both leisure and business travelers. The hotel is home to the famous Lambs Club Restaurant. This iconic hotel is the vision of the hotelier and entrepreneur Mr. Sant Singh Chatwal.



Job Responsibilities:

* Ensures property guestrooms, public space and employee areas are clean and well maintained
* Completes inspections and holds people accountable for corrective action
* Ensures guest room status is communicated to the Front Desk in a timely and efficient manner
* Inspects guestrooms on a daily basis
* Obtains list of rooms to be cleaned immediately and list of prospective check-outs or discharges to prepare work assignments
* Inventories stock to ensure adequate supplies

* Understands the impact of department’s operations on the overall property financial goals and objectives and manages to achieve or exceed budgeted goals
* Ensures all employees have proper supplies, equipment and uniforms
* Communicates areas that need attention to staff and follows up to ensure understanding
* Supervises daily Housekeeping shift operations and ensures compliance with all housekeeping policies, standards and procedures
* Ensures employees understand Marriott brand standards and Chatwal standards
* Observes service behaviors of employees and provides feedback to individuals
* Celebrates successes and publicly recognizes the contributions of team members
* Providing and Ensuring Exceptional Guest Satisfaction
* Participates in the development and implementation of corrective action plans to improve guest satisfaction
* Empowers employees to provide excellent customer service
* Emphasizes guest satisfaction during all departmental meetings and focuses on continuous improvement
* Responds to and handles guest problems and complaints
* Strives to improve service performance


**Pay Range: $60,000 - $68,000**

title: Home Health Aide
description:
Welcome to **Distinctive Living**, we're seeking a **CHHA/CNA** for our Mira Vie at Clifton.


Here at *Distinctive Living*, we want our people to realize their full potential. We're passionate about personal and professional growth and will do everything we can to help you flourish. We deeply care about our team-members and partners and strive to provide a culture where people feel valued and inspired.


The CHHA or CNA provides direct care to residents while promoting residents' highest level of functioning as directed by management. Assists in maintaining residents' environment in a safe and neat manner. Promotes quality services within facility standards, State and Federal Regulations.

**Benefits when** **choosing a career with Distinctive:**

* Medical, Dental and Vision benefits
* Paid Time Off
* 401k Retirement Plan & Life Insurance
* Team Member Assistance Program

**Responsibilities:**

* Receives and gives report to management on resident status at the beginning and end of each shift and as needed. Notifies the management of any changes in resident physical and/or mental status.
* Provides personal care to residents per their individualized plan of care.
* Documents all pertinent information regarding care as assigned.
* Prepares residents for meals and assists to and from the dining room. Assists residents with meal set up and eating.
* Assists residents with toilet and incontinence care.
* Makes room checks and verifies resident location as directed by supervisor.
* Keeps residents' apartments neat and clean.
* Performs clinical procedures according to facility standards and scope of practice regulations.
* Performs vital signs, B/Ps, weights and other trained procedures as directed by management.
* Completes prevention and restorative care including, but not limited to, PROM, AROM, ambulation, transferring, bathing, grooming, and all other ADL care.
* Maintains a working knowledge of facility infection control procedures.
* Assists in turning, positioning, and repositioning of residents as outlined in the resident's service plan.
* Participates actively in Interdisciplinary Team Process including documentation of care delivered and resident condition as directed by supervisor as assigned. Attends care plan meetings as assigned and acts as resident advocate.
* Communicates effectively with the residents, families, visitors, members of the health care team, and other disciplines.
* Actively participates in facility's Quality Assurance Program.
* Maintains education development and compliance with State and Federal Regulations and current knowledge of resident care practices.
* Has a basic knowledge of the organization in order to answer basic questions.
* Possesses working knowledge of facility emergency procedures including fire and disaster drills. Follows facility policies.
* Maintains resident confidentiality and adheres to HIPAA policies.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Required Skills and Experience:**

* High School Diploma or equivalent required.
* Must have six months of experience in a caregiving role or similar function.
* Experience with Microsoft Word and Excel preferred.
* CNA or HHA required.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Able to communicate verbally in person and over the phone.

**Apply today to learn why Distinctive Living is a certified** **Great Place to Work****!**

title: Vice President, Creative Director (Copywriter)
description:
**Who We Are:**



At M Booth, we are a culture-first communications agency that attracts the best people and the best brands to a workplace that’s alive with courage, ideas, respect and humanity. We are relentlessly passionate about our clients and their business, whether that means staying at the forefront of the digital and social evolution, sharpening our earned storytelling skills or unleashing game-changing insights that result in campaigns that win in the marketplace. We invite you into our world of creativity, ideation, and communication. Come *Be Bold*...Come work with us at M Booth.



We believe work from anywhere works. While our HQ is in NYC, we have Boothers working from more than 20 different U.S. markets. Your location will not impact your candidacy should you decide to work remotely permanently. Our priority is ensuring our current and future employees understand that we care about their wellbeing and work environment preferences.

  



Team is everything. We pride ourselves on being egoless (or close to it). If you like being part of a supportive and selfless group of people, there’s a good chance you’ll be a fit.



Intellectual curiosity is rewarded. If you love to read, consume media, tinker and make cool things, we’d love to chat.

  



In this role, you will work with our highly collaborative team of strategists, copywriters, art directors and CDs to co-create concepts and meet client demands.

  


**ABOUT THE JOB**


* Concepting and executing 360 campaigns
* Managing and mentor ad hoc creative teams
* Common projects include branding, ads, social content and PR activations
* Find and present cultural insights that inform your work
* Present your work to internal teams and external clients at all levels
* Manage your day to meet strict deadlines, and prioritize requests
* Own client relationships


**ABOUT YOU**


* 10+ years of creative copy experience with a focus on multicultural programming
* 3-5 years experience as a creative lead
* Portfolio of advertising, video and social content work
* Ability to run photo and video shoots with small to large budgets.
* Experience making creative that gets media coverage
* Proven copy skills (campaign + PR + video + content)
* Creative conceptor
* Strong collaborator
* Category experience in CPG, spirits, food and lifestyle
* Winning new business track record
* Fluent in digital
* Ability to make beautiful work across style guides for multiple clients
* Understanding of social platforms and how to drive engagement on these platforms.
* Great with feedback and revisions
* NOTE: candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S.


**In order to be considered for this position, you must provide a link to your portfolio.**

  


**What We’ll Bring:**



Here are a few highlights of the benefits we offer at M Booth:


* A workplace that’s alive with courage, ideas, respect and humanity
* Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career
* Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family
* A 401(k) Savings Plan and Flexible Spending Accounts
* Paid holidays, Unlimited Paid Time Off (Personal, Sick, Vacation), and Summer Fridays


Additional Perks: Family Leave, Well-Being Programs, and Commuter Benefits



SALARY: $165,000 - $200,000/year

  


**Our Flexible Work Policy:**



We believe that our best work happens in a hybrid working environment. If you are in the NYC (or commutable surrounding distance) hub we want to see you in person 2 days a week. That could mean in our office, in our client's office, on the road with them or attending an industry event.



For those outside the NYC hub, you will be asked to be in person too. Examples of this may include client meetings, events or team meetings. There will also be in person opportunities for you to connect with others who live in your hub to collaborate and work together.


*M Booth & Associates is an equal opportunity employer. All candidates will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*
