title: Route Sales Merchandiser - Representative
description:
**Welcome to the last job you will ever start! Our goal is to develop Reps into Merchandising Professionals and watch your career flourish within our organization. We pride ourselves on our training program and our promote-from-within policy that results in an upbeat, positive work environment and a real team-oriented culture.**

IMMEDIATE OPENINGS IN: North Jersey

*If you are genuinely a nice person, understand that time is money, can work quickly, accurately, & professionally, and can drive safely and count to 6, then CONGRATULATIONS ! – you found your next job.*

**The Details:** On The Go Hosiery, is seeking Full-Time Route Sales & Merchandising Reps to handle grocery, drug, and mass accounts in the North Jersey Area. Candidates should have at least 2 years Sales and/or Merchandising experience.

This is an ***ON THE GO JOB*** - upwards of 200-300 miles per week, 5-8 stops/day. You will drive a company vehicle - so no more mileage put onto your personal car. Company pays all travel expenses, including gas, tolls, vehicle maintenance, and other travel expenses while on company business.

**The basic servicing steps are:**

* Check-in with Dept Manager.
* Straighten the product back to the Plan-O-Gram.
* Replace any missing price tags.
* Write an order on handheld computer.
* Pull & invoice the order.
* Verify the counts with the receiver.
* Pack out the product onto our display.

This is repeated 5-8 times per day.

**Additional duties:**

* Cover all assigned stores each week.
* Merchandise our products according to company standards.
* Ensure products are placed properly and shelves are clean.
* Fill displays to avoid out of stocks.
* Rotate products.
* Complete weekly and monthly paperwork

**Job Requirements:**

* Valid driver's license, no dui's, clean driving record.
* Ability to lift 10-25 lb boxes repeatedly, up to 25 times per day.
* Ability to climb in and out of delivery truck, reach up to top shelves, bend down to bottom shelves, & drive up to 2 hours non-stop.
* Ability to work up to 50 hours per week.
* Associate's degree.
* 21 years of age or older.
* Computer literate with Internet access, Email, Excel, Word, pdf’s.
* Available to work early morning hours (5 AM start)
* Pass Drug Test and DOT Physical

**Success Criteria:** In addition to meeting the minimum requirements, successful RSRs have demonstrated:

* Firm commitment to personal values
* A strong work ethic
* Prior sales and delivery experience
* Good organizational skills
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
* A sincere willingness and desire to learn continuously

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Cell phone reimbursement
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Associate (Required)

Experience:

* Merchandising: 3 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License, no DUI's (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Preferred)

Work Location: On the road

title: Manager, Communications
description:
**Job Title**: Manager, Communications
**FLSA Status**: Exempt, Salaried
**Location:** New York, New York
**Worksite Status:** Hybrid
We’re Beam Living, a multi-family residential property management company that elevates, oversees, and supports communities throughout New York City. A Blackstone-owned portfolio company, our goal is to create fulfilling places to work, live and grow. We believe in leaving people and places better than we found them, which is why the communities we own and operate are some of the most exciting, vibrant, and iconic in New York City.
As for our team? We are a group of passionate people who believe in making every day better than yesterday. It’s who we are. We put people first because we know that’s how you create incredible communities. We value relationships and know how to balance work with life, but we are also relentless in our pursuit of doing things for the better.
We’re on a mission to make city life happier – want to join us? Since you got this far, we’re assuming the answer is, “absolutely.” So, here’s what you can expect:
**Role and Responsibilities:**
As a Senior Associate on the Communications/Marketing team, you’ll be responsible for:
* Develop, implement and coordinate our internal communications strategy to further our mission, vision, and cultural responsibilities.
* Help grow and strengthen the function by bringing big ideas to life throughout the year by developing through clear, compelling and connected user journeys across multiple touchpoints.
* Support the planning and development of internal communications activities as well as support our established cadence of comms (including Huddles, Newsletters and Town Halls) to drive an engaged (and informed) cross-section of teammates across all of our properties. This will require organizing project timelines, reviewing (or writing) the appropriate communication plans and then executing the approved plans.
* Orchestrate content creation for all internal audiences by staying closely connected with teammates across the business and keeping track of projects, initiatives and voices that should be heard (the critical stuff and the fun stuff) and folded into key comms touchpoints.
* Work closely with executive leadership team and department heads to plan, build and deploy effective communications that support business objectives and are aligned with external messaging and strategy.
* Support the development of a comprehensive social strategy and execute it on an ongoing basis, applying your understanding of brand growth and reputation, as well as how effective comms build impact and get results.
* In partnership with the Senior Director of Marketing, support the development resident communications that have a major impact on reputation and/or represent a change for the community.
* Stay informed about industry trends, internal developments, and global news to effectively tailor communication messages and strategies.


**As a key member of our team, you should be:**
* **A passionate person** who believes in helping others win by providing the resources and development necessary to grow.
* **An open-minded communicator** who establishes clear, direct expectations for team members and provides an avenue for feedback that allows people to improve every day.
* **An empathetic operator** who has an unwavering commitment to excellence and will persistently pursue the team’s objectives.
* **Authentic.** Bring your best self to work, let’s do something amazing.
* **Flexible** knowing and expecting that things change and that’s what makes our business stronger.


**What you should have:**
* Minimum of bachelor’s degree required (discipline agnostic if you can demonstrate a passion for storytelling, communications, and sharp critical analysis skills.)
* 5 years of relevant work experience in a fast-paced, corporate environment with some combination of change management, government/political campaigns, private equity, financial services, or commercial real estate.
* Outstanding verbal and written communications skills, an excellent attention to detail, and an ability to jump back and forth between internal and external communications with ease.
* Ability to build and maintain positive relationships with key internal partners; ability to hold one’s own alongside senior leadership and push things through in the face of obstacles.
* Be able to work proactively and autonomously.
* Excellent customer service skills and a passion for reader/consumer experience.
* Knowledge of social media, digital engagement, and strategic best practices for communications, reader engagement, and user experience.
* A strong creative flair, helpful if you have photography/videography/content creation experience, too.
* Expert-level proficiency with Microsoft Office; helpful if you have experience with Adobe Creative Cloud apps.
* Experience with email marketing platforms.
* Proven track record with:
	+ Managing the lifecycle of projects
	+ Change management (both creation of CM plans and implementation)
	+ Multi-media storytelling
* Ambition without ego and a people-first mentality.
* It would be a real plus if you are funny and have a deep love and passion for all things NYC.


**What we offer:**We owe it to our people - both residents and Beam team members – to do the right thing. That means making sure every building, lounge, terrace or office is a place where people are comfortable being themselves. Not just because it’s fair, but because it’s what makes us better. We know that if we take care of our team, everything else will fall into place and we do everything we can to make decisions that are in the best interest of our people. Here, we’ll always let you know where you stand, and we strive to help you get where you want to go.
**At Beam, you’ll be surrounded by people who model our Cultural Responsibilities****:**
* Be a good neighbor.
* Do the right thing.
* Help others win.
* Be Yourself.
* Be Better Today Than Yesterday (BTTY).

**Base Salary:** $80,000 - $95,000
*Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience & location.*
**Benefits:** First and foremost, we’re human. We understand that feeling good at work, means having the tools and resources you need to feel good outside of work. At Beam, we offer benefits that support the whole you – physically, emotionally, and financially. We provide a variety of benefits to team members, including health insurance coverage eligibility on your first day of work, company paid holidays, retirement savings plan, paid parental leave, educational assistance, mental health resources.
**A few of the people you will work with:***(Ctrl + click to open)*
Jasmine
Kyle
Kevin
**Diversity, equity, and inclusion is critical to our success as a company. That said, it’s not enough to just BE diverse, embracing diversity is a must. We want you to feel comfortable bringing your best self to work, which is why** **Beam Celebrates** **how diversity contributes to a welcoming inclusive environment where everyone belongs.**
**To further our commitment to fostering an environment that welcomes and embraces diversity, all employment decisions at Beam Living are based on individual qualifications, business needs and job requirements without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran or any other status protected by law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.**

title: Total Rewards Manager
description:
**Company Overview:**



NRS, our parent company for National Retail Transportation (NRT) & Keystone Freight Corp (KFC) is a leading provider of transportation & logistics services, and a family-owned and operated company that has been providing smart logistics solutions for the world’s leading retailers and manufacturers for 60+ years. Our innovative energy drives us towards new and valuable solutions for our clients, even as we continuously grow and strengthen our network. We are dedicated to creating a culture that empowers the individual and offers our associates the opportunity to apply their unique skill to the challenges facing our clients. In the office, the warehouse, or on the road, it is this commitment to our innovative spirit that unites us in common mission to push boundaries in the logistics industry.


**Job Overview:**



The Total Rewards Manager is responsible for developing and implementing our company's compensation strategies and structures to ensure competitive, equitable, and sustainable pay practices. The Compensation Manager oversees salary and wage administration, incentive plans, and the evaluation of job positions, ensuring alignment with our company's strategic objectives and compliance with regulatory standards.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Lead the development, implementation, and administration of compensation policies and programs.
* Conduct comprehensive market analyses to benchmark salary structures and ensure competitive compensation across all departments.
* Collaborate with HR and senior management to design and manage incentive and bonus programs that align with company performance and strategic goals.
* Develop and implement standard operating procedures for the establishment of new positions within the company.
* Design and oversee the implementation of salary grading systems and structures.
* Oversee job evaluations and classifications, ensuring that compensation practices comply with current laws and regulations.
* Manage annual salary review processes, including merit increases and market adjustments, ensuring they are administered fairly and consistently.
* Provide expertise and guidance on pay decisions, policy interpretations, and job evaluations to HR partners and management.
* Develop and prepare compensation-related reports and presentations for executive leadership and the board.
* Stay abreast of trends, regulations, and best practices in compensation to recommend changes and enhancements to current programs.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field is required.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in compensation, including design, analysis, and administration of salary and incentive programs.
* Experience with UKG software is highly regarded, as it demonstrates a comprehensive capability to utilize advanced HR technology solutions for efficient compensation planning and analysis.
* Experience in the transportation, logistics, or related industry is beneficial but not required.
* Proven track record of managing complex compensation projects and initiatives.
* In-depth knowledge of compensation strategies, structures, and best practices.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to manage large datasets and provide actionable insights.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain complex compensation information to a variety of audiences.
* Familiarity with federal, state, and local compensation laws and regulations.


**Physical Demands:**


* Extended Sitting: Primarily desk-based with prolonged computer use.
* Computer Use: Frequent operation of computers and office equipment, requiring manual dexterity.
* Eye Strain and Repetitive Motion: Risk from continuous screen use and repetitive tasks like typing.
* Office Navigation: Light walking and standing for meetings and tasks within the office.
* Light Lifting: Occasional handling of objects up to 20 pounds.


**EEO Statement:**



NRS is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: BD Director – Sectors & Clients / Life Sciences & Est. Industries
description:
A&O Shearman is a new global industry-leading law firm, with nearly 50 offices in 29 countries worldwide. Our fluency in English law, US law, and the laws of the world’s most dynamic markets, enables us to provide unmatched insight and seamless delivery to clients. We work on challenging and important deals and disputes that have the potential to shape the future.  

  

Whether you're helping clients solve complex challenges, transforming the ways we manage our business, or ensuring the smooth-running of our operations, this is an environment where you can belong and excel.  

  

What truly defines a career with us? We recruit the best and ask for the best of you. And together, we will redefine success.  

  

**DEPARTMENT PURPOSE AND STRUCTURE**  

The U.S. Marketing & Business Development team is a sophisticated group of experienced professionals charged with guiding the Firm’s fee earners to grow U.S. and global revenues, expand client relationships and strategically tackle new client pursuits.  

  

As business professionals at one of the largest law firms in the world, the U.S. MKT Team thrives on market challenges and outside-the-box thinking. It is a team where fresh ideas are not only entertained, they’re encouraged.  

  

**ROLE PURPOSE**  

The Director of Sectors & Clients – Life Sciences & Established Industries is responsible for leading business development and marketing initiatives across the two sectors and their client base. The “Established Industries” sectors touches many areas of focus for the Firm, including automotive, retail and consumer, industrials, etc.  

  

Working with the U.S. sector heads, partners, practice aligned BD colleagues, and the extended global Marketing team, the Director – LS & EI will guide the execution of business initiatives that align with the firm’s established priorities and plans including, capitalizing on potential revenue opportunities across practice areas and geographies relevant to the sectors, developing strategy for robust client programs, targeting new clients not supported by existing firm framework, and creating processes and priorities for expanding reach within these specific sectors through thought leadership campaigns and other targeted visibility and profile raising.  

  

This is a high visibility role and will collaborate with marketing and business development, business services, regional managing partners, and practice group leaders.  

  

**KEY RELATIONSHIPS*** U.S. Sector Heads
* U.S. Practice Leaders
* U.S. Directors of Business Development and their teams
* Global Business Development team members

**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

  

**CONTEXT**  

This role is partner facing and involves serving as the go-to for partners and other fee earners for all BD and marketing within the U.S. LS & EI Industries practice groups. The Director – LS & EI is crucial to the groups’ execution of their strategies and the day-to-day success of the business. A successful candidate should be able to show a proven track record of leading partners to new business wins and notable client relationship expansion.  

  

**ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES*** Complete business plans for successful integration and leveraging of capabilities and client prospects.
* Lead strategy and execution of a client and sector program in the United States for the Life Sciences and Established Industry groups.
* Develop and oversee firm-wide revenue generating opportunities from existing and potential clients.
* Manage sector efforts including collaboration with practice groups on pitches and submissions and the creation of programs for sector client outreach through targeted thought leadership campaigns and other proactive trend analysis and reporting.
* Target clients brought through lateral hiring to introduce cross-practice and regional capabilities.
* Create process for better succession and transition of client relationships, both planned and unplanned.
* Engage partners in proactive planning for successful integration into client relationships.
* Increase engagement with local counsel as source of referrals and coordinate globally across regions.
* Coordinate with in-house PR & Communications team to increase visibility of the firm in the legal, business, and trade media within these sectors.
* Hire, manage, mentor, and develop staff; ensure all functional resources are in alignment with the Firm’s vision and strategic objectives and perform at the highest level of quality, consistency and efficiency.
* Position self as trusted advisor to partners and senior stakeholders on marketing and business development initiatives for the sectors you support.
* Execute ad hoc requests to support special projects, practices, and initiatives as needed.
* Contribute sector credentials to relevant pitches, proposals and RFPs.
* Collaborate with the Firm’s DEI team to partner with clients on various initiatives.
* Seek out smart investments and coordinate Firm sponsorships of conferences (e.g., targeting speaker opportunities, coordinating materials and speakers, conducting event follow-up, etc.) and, together with the U.S. Events team, planning client events and seminars relevant to the sectors.

  

**TEAM**  

This position reports directly to the Chief Marketing & Business Development Officer – Americas but also works closely with other members of the business team, including but not limited to the wider MKT team, HR, Finance, etc.  

  

**KEY REQUIREMENTS*** Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required; advanced degree such as a J.D. or MBA preferred.
* Minimum 10 years of experience in marketing and business development leadership role in a professional services environment.
* Direct management experience specifically related to team building, managing performance, goal setting, and delivering constructive feedback.
* Culturally astute with a strong ability to work effectively with colleagues from other countries on cross-border activities.
* A tenacious, proactive approach to achieving results and with a demonstrable track record of helping to successfully grow a practice group, sector, or client base.
* A strong team player, with experience of developing successful working relationships with other business development team members.
* Capacity to lead and motivate a team, cultivate team environment where ideas can be shared, questions can be asked, and individuals are accountable for performance.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal and influencing skills – ability to develop and create relationships with respect and credibility with senior partners, stakeholders, and business unit leaders.
* High attention to detail and strong client focus.
* Track record of developing and executing programs that cut through industry noise to measurably achieve marketing and business development objectives and key results.
* Solution oriented with a track record as a problem solver with the ability to manage multiple priorities.
* Proactive self-starter, resilient, highly organized and works well with peers, as well as with fee earners at all levels.
* Ability to work in an environment with shifting priorities to meet time-sensitive deadlines.
* Great networking and advocacy skills; able to build relationships with stakeholders both internally and externally.


This is an outstanding opportunity for an experienced business development professional working closely with an energetic group of people, in a busy law firm environment.  

**Additional information - External**


For individuals assigned to or hired for this opportunity in New York, the annualized base salary range for this position is $210,000 to $262,000. The actual base salary offered will depend on the overall qualifications of the individual applicant for the position and other job-related factors permitted by law.

title: BD Manager - IP Litigation
description:
A&O Shearman is a new global industry-leading law firm, with nearly 50 offices in 29 countries worldwide. Our fluency in English law, US law, and the laws of the world’s most dynamic markets, enables us to provide unmatched insight and seamless delivery to clients. We work on challenging and important deals and disputes that have the potential to shape the future.  

  

Whether you're helping clients solve complex challenges, transforming the ways we manage our business, or ensuring the smooth-running of our operations, this is an environment where you can belong and excel.  

  

What truly defines a career with us? We recruit the best and ask for the best of you. And together, we will redefine success.  

  

**DEPARTMENT PURPOSE AND STRUCTURE**  

Our U.S. Litigation Practice provides clients with a full-service offering, with a deep bench. Our growing Litigation Practice serves clients in disputes, financial institutions litigation, regulatory and white collar defense, antitrust, internal investigations and special investigations for boards, securities litigation, corruption investigations and litigation related to regulatory compliance, intellectual property, and professional liability.  

  

Our intellectual property team supports the world’s leading businesses to invest in and protect global intellectual property portfolios, and is a growing team in the U.S. With over 120 specialist IP partners and associates worldwide, A&O Shearman offers an integrated, cross-border service to help clients dealing with the opportunities and threats brought by globalization and technology.  

  

Many of our IP lawyers come from a science, technology, or an engineering background and have a deep understanding of the sectors in which our clients operate. This is combined with our leading antitrust, arbitration, employment and regulatory experience, and one of the largest international networks of any law firm.  

  

One of our key differentiators in the U.S. is the truly integrated nature of the advice we give, and our U.S. IP Litigation team is at the forefront of the cross-border expertise that makes A&O Shearman stand out. Successfully managing risks requires an understanding of both the technical legal requirements of multiple jurisdictions, the investigative methods used by government regulators and criminal prosecutors, and the practical concerns of our clients.  

  

**ROLE PURPOSE**  

This role is a fantastic opportunity to gain global experience working for one of the largest law firms in the world and to learn the unique approach that a truly global firm utilizes towards business development and marketing. Our U.S. team works cooperatively with our colleagues located in over 40 other offices throughout the world as one integrated team.  

  

The BD manager will provide day-to-day business development support to the U.S. IP litigation team as a whole, and will work closely with a technology and life sciences sector-focused business development professional, focusing primarily on the IP litigation partners. The BD manager will work with business development teams across the firm to help support the group worldwide. This includes responding to client requests for proposals, coordination of the IP Litigation practice’s involvement in firm-wide initiatives, education of the wider firm on the practice’s expertise, sponsorship and event management, collateral creation and management, and legal directory submissions.  

  

This position reports to the senior BD manager for the firm’s Litigation and Regulatory Practices, and works closely with other members of the U.S. business development/marketing team. The business development manager will have support from junior members of the U.S. business development team.  

  

**KEY RELATIONSHIPS*** IP litigation partners and associates
* Litigation/life Sciences/tech sector practice partners and associates
* Business development team members

  

**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

  

**CONTEXT**  

This role involves acting as a reliable point of contact as it relates to the BD function of the IP litigation group. The BD manager function is crucial to the day-to-day success of the business and this individual will play an essential part in this model.  

  

**ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES*** Working closely with the attorneys to develop and implement the business development strategy and plans for each partner and their practices.
* Working directly with attorneys to create competitive proposals, credentials, pitches, and presentations for work originating in the IP Litigation Practice and for work from the A&O Shearman network, involving the IP Litigation Practice area.
* Sharing ideas with colleagues in order to enhance quality and efficiency of work and developing best practices in coordination with the Americas business development team as a whole.
* Conducting market research on existing and prospective clients and market issues which may impact clients’ businesses and providing advice on effective marketing strategies to address these issues.
* Arranging and chairing meetings with the practice groups to review progress on marketing projects and key client targeting; ensuring relevant information from these meetings is circulated to other relevant internal groups.
* Working with our PR team to spot opportunities and maintain effective press coverage on major market developments; drafting entries for legal and industry directories. Determination of high profile-matters and issues of the IP Litigation Practice in order to ensure press and internal coverage where appropriate.
* Identifying and coordinating firm sponsorships of conferences (e.g., targeting speaker opportunities, coordinating materials and speakers, conducting event follow-up, etc.) and, together with the U.S. Events Specialist, planning client events and seminars.
* Maintaining records (in our global database) of IP litigation proposals and matters and ensuring that information about these matters is appropriately documented and disseminated to other internal groups.
* Mentoring and collaborating with junior team members, ensuring appropriate work opportunities and allocation, and support of team members’ long-term goals and training. Managing appraisals and coordinating promotion discussions as needed.

**TEAM**  

This position reports directly to the Director, BD Disputes, but also works closely with other members of staff, including but not limited to the wider BD team and litigation, life sciences and tech sector team members.  

  

**KEY REQUIREMENTS*** Culturally astute with a strong ability to work effectively with colleagues from other countries on cross-border activities.
* 5 to 8 years of professional services experience working in a high-profile, fast-paced environment.
* Experience in, and ability to deliver at, a complex organization.
* A tenacious, proactive approach to achieving results and with a demonstrable track record of helping to successfully grow a practice group.
* A self-starter with the ability to prioritize, multi-task, and drive forward multiple projects, using limited partner availability in the most effective way.
* A strong team player, with experience of developing successful working relationships with other business development team members.
* Excellent interpersonal and influencing skills—with partners, associates, and business development colleagues.
* High attention to detail and strong client focus.
* Bachelor’s degree required.

**Additional information - External**


For individuals assigned to or hired for this opportunity in New York, the annualized base salary range for this position is $140,000 to $180,000. The actual base salary offered will depend on the overall qualifications of the individual applicant for the position and other job-related factors permitted by law.

title: BD Manager - Comp, Employment & Governance / Environmental & Sanctions
description:
A&O Shearman is a new global industry-leading law firm, with nearly 50 offices in 29 countries worldwide. Our fluency in English law, US law, and the laws of the world’s most dynamic markets, enables us to provide unmatched insight and seamless delivery to clients. We work on challenging and important deals and disputes that have the potential to shape the future.  

  

Whether you're helping clients solve complex challenges, transforming the ways we manage our business, or ensuring the smooth-running of our operations, this is an environment where you can belong and excel.  

  

What truly defines a career with us? We recruit the best and ask for the best of you. And together, we will redefine success.  

  

**DEPARTMENT PURPOSE AND STRUCTURE**  

Operating in more than 40 countries at the forefront of our industry—A&O Shearman is one of the world’s leading corporate advisers. Working alongside some of the world’s most successful companies, commercial and investment banks and private equity firms, the corporate work we do breaks new ground and sets precedents.  

  

Our clients know us as an ambitious, creative and enterprising team of individuals who embrace the most complex and cutting-edge commercial ventures. We find innovative new ways to deliver our services and exceed expectations on public takeovers, private M&A, equity capital markets, private equity, joint ventures and commercial partnerships, disposals and corporate reorganizations.  

  

Combined with our transactional expertise, the structure includes a full range of specialist areas including, commercial, employment and benefits, environmental, intellectual property, transactions, tax and corporate governance.  

  

**ROLE PURPOSE**  

The candidate will be the main point of contact and oversee all day-to-day business development support for our U.S. Corporate partners and support on key initiatives for several Corporate practice groups, including Compensation, Employment & Governance (CEG) and Environmental & Sanctions. The role will also support the Director on a variety of projects relating to the firm’s Public Company Advisory initiative.  

  

The position will require working with BD teams around the world to help support this group. This includes identification and prioritization of clients, coordination of partners and associates responsible for managing client relationships, client targeting efforts, lateral integration, proposal writing and management, deal list and business development collateral creation and management, and legal directory submissions.  

  

The candidate will play a critical role in maintaining, nurturing and expanding client relationships for this practice and collaborating with global BD colleagues and Global Client Relationship Managers.  

  

This position reports directly to the Director of Business Development and will work very closely with all of the U.S. CEG and Environmental & Sanctions partners, including the Global Heads of both teams and members of the global business development/marketing team.  

  

The candidate must have an understanding of corporate matters, strong attention to detail, and have client centric and solutions focused approach to their work.  

  

**KEY RELATIONSHIPS*** Director, Business Development
* All partners and fee earners in the U.S. CEG and Environmental and Sanctions practices
* Partner lead for the Public Company Advisory initiative
* Business Development Manager, U.S. Capital Markets
* U.S. BD team
* Peers across the wider business development, marketing and PR & communications teams

**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

  

**CONTEXT**  

The managerial functions operate in an environment where the provision of a top-quality service and product is paramount. Innovation and creative ideas are encouraged.  

  

This role involves regular interaction with partners, including Global Heads, but also contact with all levels of staff within the group. The BD & Marketing team has a seat at the leadership table and its input into strategic conversations is always encouraged.  

  

This position is multi-faceted and involves the management of key initiatives, including practice strategy, pitches and RFPs, market research and analysis, and directories, rankings and submissions execution. Due to the constantly changing nature of the business, change management is an increasingly important part of the role.  

  

**ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES*** Working directly with attorneys to create and manage competitive proposals, credentials, pitches and presentations.
* Working closely with attorneys to develop and implement the BD strategy and plans for the practice.
* Collaboration and integration with other parts of the firm, especially the global Client Relationship Management team and global Corporate BD team is essential.
* Working with partners to develop a process to do pitch, matter and relationship debriefs, in conjunction with the global client listening team and client relationship teams.
* Developing a deep understand of key sectors relevant to the practice to identify market trends and highlight practice and client opportunities.
* Using an understanding of the firm’s international partner and business development network to coordinate existing projects and develop new opportunities. Sharing ideas with colleagues in order to enhance quality and efficiency of work and developing best practices for the practice groups and the business development team as a whole.
* Developing and maintaining effective marketing processes for assigned groups.
* Work with the U.S. client events team to plan and run client and charity events and seminars.
* Coordinate and attend firm sponsorships of conferences throughout the year.
* Maintain up-to-date “master” list of deals and share relevant information relating to the deals with other internal groups and to externally managed databases and league tables.
* Work with our U.S. PR & Communications team to maintain effective press coverage on major deals and market developments and drafting submissions for directories.

**TEAM**  

This position reports directly to the Director, Business Development (Corporate) and works closely with other members of the U.S. business development/marketing team and members of the A&O Shearman global community. The Business Development Manager will directly support junior members of the U.S. Corporate business development team.  

  

**KEY REQUIREMENTS*** At least 5 years of professional services experience working in a high profile, fast-paced environment.
* Experience in, and ability to deliver at a complex organization.
* A proactive approach to achieving results and a demonstrable track record of helping to grow a practice group.
* A self-starter with the ability to prioritize, multi-task, and drive forward multiple projects, using limited partner availability in the most effective way.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal and influencing skills—with partners, associates, and business development colleagues.
* Willingness and enthusiasm to develop an in-depth understanding of markets in which your practice areas operate.
* Innovative thinking.
* High attention to detail and strong client focus.
* Bachelor's degree required.
* This is an outstanding opportunity for an experienced business development professional to work closely with an energetic group of people in a busy law firm environment. We are looking for an individual who is proactive, persistent, committed to “getting the job done”, and a supportive colleague.

**Additional information - External**


For individuals assigned to or hired for this opportunity in New York, the annualized base salary range for this position is $140,000 to $180,000. The actual base salary offered will depend on the overall qualifications of the individual applicant for the position and other job-related factors permitted by law.

title: Journeyman Laborer Journeyman
description:
About Your Future with American National Insulation
Are you looking for a career with an industry leader that drives the future of energy-efficient insulation and building material products? Is being part of a company that is recognized as a *“Great Place to Work”* of value to you? Look no further! At American National Insulation, you will be part of a diverse and inclusive team that reflects our values of integrity and innovation by delivering solutions that make a difference in the communities we serve. Here, you are part of a company that rewards your contributions and encourages you to take ownership of your career.
Job Description
Your Responsibilities
As a Journeyman, you will be responsible for practicing best insulation practices and training insulation, plaster, sealer and spray helpers.* Install products as allowed by associated collective bargaining agreement and/or project labor agreement.
* Understand blueprints and sketches. Measure, shape, and cut materials to specified measurements.
* Insulate, spray, plaster, trowel, seal, cover, wrap, staple, glue and fit insulating/sealant/foam/materials.
* Review your daily work schedule and ensure truck is loaded with all product(s), tools and equipment for the day.
* Complete vehicle safety and job site inspections.
* Safely unload and stage material at job site.
* Report safety, customer or quality concerns.
* Maintain a clean work area at all times.
* Any other duty, task, or responsibilities as assigned per the CBAs.


Your Qualifications* Minimum of 18 years of age.
* If operating a Company Vehicle, a valid driver’s license will be required.


THIS IS A SAFETY SENSITIVE POSITION
Travel Requirements
Type of Travel Required: Local; Out of town travel as required.
Daily travel to job sites.
Physical Requirements
Able to lift 50 lbs. unassisted to load and unload various products. Climb, stoop, kneel, crawl, and stand to perform daily work and ladder climbing, as needed. This includes confined spaces and small areas.
TopBuild Corp. (NYSE: BLD) is the leading installer and distributor of insulation and building material services nationwide. American National Insulation is part of the TopBuild family of companies, which comprises of approximately over 450 branch locations across the United States and Canada. As a company, we actively engage in corporate social responsibility through our commitment to Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) practices. Additionally, we prioritize diversity and inclusion in our organization. If this interests you, we encourage you to join our company and find a variety of career opportunities awaiting you!
TopBuild Corp. is an equal opportunity employer (EOE), this includes protected Veterans/Disability. The employee must be able to perform the essential functions of the position. Upon request and absent undue hardship, reasonable accommodation will be offered to enable employees with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**About Schroders**



We’re a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future.



We have around 5,000 people on six continents. And we’ve been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn’t change is our commitment to helping our clients and society prosper.

  

**The Base**



We are based at 7 Bryant Park in the heart of NYC. And we have everything we need to work flexibly. We operate a hybrid working model, with a requirement that our Business Analyst be in the office 3 days per week. This is to sustain our culture of innovation, collaboration, knowledge sharing, and building relationships within the business

  

**The Team**



This is an opportunity to work interdependently with an engaged team that sits within a Global Technology function at a global asset management firm.

  

**Position Overview**



We are looking for a Business Analyst with the experience and desire to help design and optimize Marketing Automation & Analytics solutions, and Marketing Technology Innovation initiatives (AI adoption, emerging technologies analysis, regional proof of concepting) within the our regional and global teams. Our marketing technology stack is underpinned by our core applications consisting of Salesforce, Pardot, TealiumiQ and Cvent. In collaboration with our Digital Marketing experts, we want someone who is passionate about building the tools to allow us to facilitate great client engagement.



To excel in this role, it is essential to possess a blend of creative and analytical skills. You should be able to quickly grasp and effectively communicate business requests. This will mean you thoroughly explore them, and actively contribute to the secure implementation of changes in our production environment.



You need to demonstrate strong stakeholder management across technical and non-technical teams. Interacting across Marketing, Events, and Sales colleagues you will create, develop and maintain marketing systems that increase and improve client engagement. To be successful you must also demonstrate collaboration with other technology teams to promote solutions which align to our strategic intent.



As an experienced analyst, you'll be in an integral role within both the global Marketing Automation & Analytics team, and on the regional digitization team. You will focus on technical integrations, enhancements, marketing innovation and adoption of new technologies. You will be involved in various aspects of the delivery lifecycle including but not limited to; running workshops, scoping enhancements or new project concepts, creating delivery plans, configuring our marketing technology platforms and supporting the team to provide solutions.

  

**Responsibilities**


* Apply a wide variety of business analysis tools and techniques to capture business needs, discover requirements, map out domains and generate solutions
* Demonstrable expertise in Salesforce configuration capabilities, including but not limited to Flows, Dynamic Forms, Permission Sets and Sharing Rules
* Configuration of CRM Analytics
* Create alignment and ownership between multiple stakeholder groups
* Ensure scope is well managed and considers value, feasibility, and implementation constraints
* Own the discovery phase of multiple new project initiatives that crosscut the needs of multiple teams
* Ensure the technology team’s backlog is well maintained, appropriately detailed and clearly articulates business value
* Facilitate sprint events and ensure the team are following Agile ways of working and best practice
* Proven experience in leading complex projects and implementations
* Proven experience of Account Engagement (formerly known as Pardot) and its integration with supporting MarTech platforms
* Building custom integrations and user interfaces using Pardot API
* A solid understating of global marketing preferences and GDPR
* Work across disciplinary and geographic boundaries to develop and deploy the best solutions possible for our users.

  

  

**Basic Qualifications**


* Salesforce Admin and Pardot Specialist certification
* Experience with salesforce deployment release cycle (SF DX, Gearset)
* Self-motivated and enthusiastic
* An excellent communicator and problem solver with an aptitude for critical thinking
* Someone who has high technical literacy, with experience in a hands-on development role
* Ability to manage requests and expectations from multiple business and technical stakeholders
* Resourceful with a skill for removing impediments and navigating problems faced by the team
* Someone who acts to break down information and knowledge silos
* Skilled at building and sustaining positive relationships with a bias towards achieving buy-in
* Able to work under pressure, on several priorities at once, and with tight deadlinesCapable of balancing timely delivery against strategic development
* Adaptable and flexible, such that you will consider the right tool for the situation at hand instead of relying on the same ‘go-to' tools / approaches
* Able to adopt a servant-leader approach supporting the team
* Understand the importance of non-functional requirements and how to go about capturing them
* Ability to adapt and pick up new product domains quickly
* Solid understanding of Agile principles and practices
* Able to challenge stakeholders diplomatically but robustly when appropriate
* Have a continuous improvement mindset and always be looking for new ways to better our platforms and client engagement technologies.
* Experience with Cloud technologies e.g. Azure Fundamentals or AWS.

  

  

**Preferred Qualifications**


* Agile certification e.g. Scrum.org
* Salesforce certifications; Sales Cloud, App Builder and Pardot Consultant
* Experience with CRM Analytics and CDP configuration
* Experience with Cloud technologies e.g. Azure Fundamentals or AWS.
* A solid understating of global marketing preferences and GDPR

  

  

**Compensation**



Schroders offers a base salary in a range of $100,000 to $110,000 for this position.



The referenced salary range is based on the Company's good faith belief at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on factors such as geographic location, work experience, market conditions, education/training and skill level.

  

**ADA**



Schroder Investment Management North America Inc. complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

  

**We recognize potential, whoever you are**



Our purpose is to provide excellent investment performance to clients through active management. Diversity of thought facilitated by an inclusive culture will allow us to make better decisions and better achieve our purpose. This is why inclusion and diversity are a strategic priority for us and why we are an equal opportunities employer: you are welcome here regardless of your age, disability, gender identity, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, socio-economic background or any other protected characteristics

title: Dental Assistant
description:

At Gentle Dental, we pride ourselves on providing exceptional dental care in a warm and welcoming environment. Our well-established family practice in Commack is dedicated to ensuring our patients receive the highest quality of care with a gentle touch.

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented individual who also possesses administrative skills. This role is perfect for someone who is passionate about patient care and has a knack for organization and multitasking. As a key member of our team, you will support both the clinical and administrative functions of our practice, ensuring a seamless experience for our patients.

Join the Gentle Dental Family and be a part of a team that values care, compassion, and community. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Biller
description:
**Reports to:** CFO

**Job Purpose:** Manges accounts payable and receivable for Medicaid and CSS billing.

* Verify consumer eligibility for CSS billing.
* Completes all necessary insurance claims for billing process.
* Tracks CSS authorizations.
* Process Medicaid and CSS billing, receipts and application of cash.
* Report of claim statements, paid, unpaid and rejections.
* Maintain all accounts payable files to include filing invoices in designated areas. Update vendor information on Traverse.
* Match purchase orders with vendor invoices to assure accuracy and prepare for computer entry on a daily basis.
* Prepare all accounts payable checks according to company procedures.
* Mail accounts payable checks with appropriate supporting documentation.
* Print all accounts payable reports.
* Assist with monthly closing procedures as required.
* Monitor all paperwork, invoices, correspondence and verbal communication with vendors.
* Perform end of the month procedures as required.
* Research and respond to all accounts payable inquires in a prompt manner.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

title: Rolex Representative
description:

title: Operations & Maintenance Assistant
description:
Come join Energy Support Services, where we lead the charge in distributed generation solar solutions! We oversee projects ranging from 50 kW to 10 MW DC, spanning rooftops, carports, and ground mounts across diverse US locations. We are looking for candidates with a can-do attitude and a willingness to learn! No solar experience? No problem! We provide training. If you're reliable, detail-oriented, and safety-conscious, we want you on our team. Let's power up together and lead the charge in sustainable energy solutions!

Key Responsibilities & Job Objectives:

* The O&M Tech Assistant will assist with the maintenance and repair of Solar Photovoltaic Systems.
* Providing assistance to both Level 1 and Level 2 O&M Technicians in daily duties including, but not limited to: Annual Preventative Maintenance inspections, troubleshooting and repair of solar photovoltaic systems.
* Assist with moving materials around job sites.
* Utilize hand and power tools to assist O&M technician in daily duties.
* Record and report all faults, deficiencies, and other nonconformances on site. Document time, material, and travel expenses for the completion of daily responsibilities.
* Communicate effectively with internal team, third-party vendors, and actively participate in team meetings.
* Note general field conditions on site, including vegetation management issues, security risks, and debris impacts.
* Able to travel on short notice and be available during non-traditional working hours.
* All other duties as assigned.
* Up to 50% travel expected.

Education & Experience:

* High school diploma or equivalent; Degree or technical certification in related electrical field.
* Experience with construction or electrical work.
* Valid driver’s license.

Special Requirements:

* Comfortable operating in low voltage and non-hazardous situations with supervision
* Applicants should already be comfortable using hand tools, impact drills, sawzalls, and hammer drills.
* Strong written/verbal communication skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, Adobe Acrobat, and Outlook.
* Have a strong attention to detail.
* Be a self-starter with strong time management skills.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

* Be able to drive a vehicle confidently and with a high degree of safety.
* Be able to stand for long periods of time and walk distances up to three miles a day.
* Be able to navigate ladders, stairs, scaffolding, ramps while maintaining 3 points of contact.
* Have the visual acuity for depth perception, no field of vision issues, and to distinguish between colors.
* Be comfortable working in a variety of climate conditions which may include but are not limited to, extreme heat (temperatures above 100°F) or extreme cold (temperatures below 32°F) for periods of more than one hour.
* Be able to exert up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 30 pounds of force frequently, and/or up to 10 pounds of force constantly to move objects.

ABOUT US:

At New Energy Equity, a proud subsidiary of ALLETE, we’re leading the charge in transforming the energy landscape with innovative solar solutions . As a top player in the renewable energy sector, we’ve successfully developed over 600MW of solar projects and closed more than $1.2 billion in clean energy investments . Our projects deliver sustainable electricity to a wide range of clients, including commercial, industrial, municipal, and utility customers .

But there’s more to us than just impressive numbers. We pride ourselves on a dynamic and engaging work environment where teamwork, continuous learning, and environmental stewardship are at the core of what we do . Our inclusive and collaborative culture encourages creativity and innovation, making our office a place where every idea is valued, and growth is a priority.

At New Energy Equity, you’ll join a passionate team that not only drives the clean energy future but also enjoys celebrating our successes together . With over 250 projects across the U.S., our supportive atmosphere ensures a balanced work-life dynamic ⚖ and a fun, fulfilling career path .

Join us and be part of a forward-thinking company where your contributions are celebrated, and your professional development is supported as we work towards a brighter, sustainable future .

title: Web Content Strategist
description:
**Location Designation:** Hybrid - 2 days per week

  

Join New York Life Investment Management and become part of a dynamic team empowering investors to achieve their financial goals. We offer clients unparalleled access to a diverse collection of specialized, independent investment teams — each with its own distinct philosophy and expertise. By collaborating with our world-class investment teams, you'll shape investment strategies that unlock opportunities, navigate market complexities, and ultimately build strong financial legacies for our clients.

  

We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Web Content Strategist to join our dynamic Global Brand & Digital Marketing team at New York Life Investments. In this pivotal role, you will enhance our digital presence and ensure that our web content not only aligns with our business goals but also meets the needs of our diverse audience.

  

As a Senior Web Content Strategist, you will spearhead the development and execution of our online content strategy. You will work closely with cross-functional teams and senior leadership to deploy effective web content and product initiatives. Your expertise in SEO-focused website copywriting, data analysis, and technical knowledge will be crucial in navigating market complexities and unlocking opportunities.

 **What You'll Do:**

* Lead website content projects of varying sizes, working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure projects align with the broader objectives of the firm. Act as the primary liaison for stakeholders, effectively handling project communications, addressing concerns, and managing expectations throughout the project lifecycle.
* Develop and implement a comprehensive website content strategy that supports marketing initiatives, ensures content consistency with brand voice, style, and tone, and optimizes content for SEO, UX, accessibility, and legal requirements.
* Conduct content audits and leverage advanced analytics to assess performance, refine strategies, and enhance user engagement by interpreting web traffic metrics and user feedback.
* Develop and manage editorial calendars and roadmaps, work closely with partners to ensure timely execution.
* Utilize search engine optimization best practices to increase traffic and engagement on our digital platforms.
* Stay updated with industry trends and competitor strategies to ensure our content remains innovative and relevant.
* Provide leadership and mentorship to junior content strategist, actively guiding development and overseeing projects to ensure high-quality, consistent content that aligns with strategic goals.

 **What You'll Bring:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Journalism, Marketing, or a related field, with at least 5 years of experience in web content strategy, creation, and management, ideally within the financial services sector.
* Proven leadership skills with a strong track record of successfully managing and inspiring teams in a dynamic business environment.
* Proficient in using content management systems, conducting keyword research, and applying SEO best practices. Experience with data-driven SEO analysis and optimization.
* Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills with a proven ability to create compelling and high-quality content.
* Strong communicator and creative thinker, with an ability to use both data and intuition to inform decisions.
* Demonstrated enthusiasm for and understanding of content creation and UX writing, including best practices and emerging trends
* Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize workload

  



**Nice to have:**

* Experience in the development of content inventories, taxonomies, and strategies
* Experience working directly on an international product or a portfolio of global websites is a plus.
* Experience writing for multiple marketing lifecycle touchpoints.

title: Patient Access Representative
description:
Patient Access Representative


As a Patient Access Representative, you play a critical role in ensuring the seamless operation of the healthcare environment, the delivery of quality patient care, and world-class customer service. Your responsibilities encompass greeting and assisting patients, managing appointments, maintaining accurate records, and providing essential administrative support. Additionally, you are responsible for obtaining authorizations and facilitating insurance-related processes to support the delivery of healthcare services.

**Who We Are:**

  

JAG Physical Therapy’s care-first model of rehabilitation may be the change you are looking for! JAG Physical Therapy, a comprehensive outpatient, orthopedic physical therapy company with 100 facilities throughout Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and New York, is seeking compassionate and motivated individuals to join our winning team! JAG has been honored by the area’s top publications as the best in the business based on growth and outcomes and is considered the Gold Standard for physical therapy care by the Metro area’s largest healthcare systems and insurance providers.

 **What You’ll Love About Us:**

* Competitive pay
* Support for ongoing education and training
* Opportunities for advanced growth including team leader, regional manager, and director
* Provided uniforms
* Health, Dental, & Vision Benefits
* HSA Options including dependent care, medical, and commuter benefits
* $10,000.00 Term Life Insurance benefit at NO cost to employees
* up to 3 weeks PTO
* 401(k) with company match
* Yearly review for growth opportunities
* Tuition discounts for employees and their families
* TicketsAtWork and LifeMart company perks
* Our workplace fosters a close-knit and supportive environment where individuals genuinely care for and uplift one another, creating a strong sense of unity and camaraderie

 **What You’ll Need:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Completion of a medical assistant certificate program preferred.
* 1+ years of experience working as a medical receptionist/administrative assistant in the health care field.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills
* Strong interpersonal communication skills
* Ability to work independently or as part of a team
* Availability to travel throughout JAG locations for coverage. Following the JAG Travel policy.

 **What You’ll Do:**

* Greeting patients and other visitors in the medical office.
* Answer patient questions and provide assistance and directions when necessary.
* Field all phone calls that arrive using our general office number.
* Utilize medical office software to schedule new and follow-up appointments for patients.
* Register new patients and update necessary records.
* Distribute forms and paperwork to patients to ensure that required fields are completed appropriately.
* Daily collection of patient financial responsibility
* Maintain confidentiality of all patient records.
* Completing and tracking insurance verifications, authorizations, and referrals.
* Knowledge of Workers’ Compensation and Auto claim submissions.
* Perform other diverse duties as requested or required.

 ***Important Disclaimer Notice:***


The above statements are only intended to represent the essential job functions and general nature of the work being performed and are not exhaustive of the tasks that an Employee may be required to perform. The employer reserves the right to revise this job description at any time and to require Employees to perform other tasks as circumstances or conditions of its business, competitive considerations, or the work environment change. This job description is not a guarantee of employment. What you’ll love about us section is based on full time employment with the company and is not guaranteed based on employment type.

title: Clinical Director
description:
Clinical Director


The Physical Therapist Clinical Director is responsible for complete oversight of operations and administration of rehabilitative outpatient clinic providing Physical and Occupational Therapy. Ensures compliance with all regulations and health care requirements. This position is also responsible for patient evaluation and treatment.

**Who We Are:**


JAG Physical Therapy’s care-first model of rehabilitation may be the change you are looking for! JAG Physical Therapy, a comprehensive outpatient, orthopedic physical therapy company with 100 facilities throughout Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and New York, is seeking compassionate and motivated individuals to join our winning team! JAG has been honored by the area’s top publications as the best in the business based on growth and outcomes and is considered the Gold Standard for physical therapy care by the Metro area’s largest healthcare systems and insurance providers.

 **What You’ll Love About Us:**

* Join a company where our executive leaders are actively engaged as treating clinicians
* up to $7,500 sign-on bonus
* up to $2,500 relocation bonus
* Total Compensation Package of $95,000- $115,000
* Yearly Bonus based on the performance of the Clinic
* Health, Dental, & Vision Benefits
* HSA Options including dependent care, medical, and commuter benefits
* $10,000.00 Term Life Insurance benefit at NO cost to employees
* up to 4 weeks PTO
* 401(k) with company match
* Continuing Education reimbursements
* MedBridge Membership
* Yearly review for growth opportunities
* Professional Development Growth Tracks
* Tuition discounts for employees and their families
* TicketsAtWork and LifeMart company perks
* Our workplace fosters a close-knit and supportive environment where individuals genuinely care for and uplift one another, creating a strong sense of unity and camaraderie

**What You’ll Need:**

* Bachelors or Masters Degree required, Doctorate degree preferred
* Professional License/Certification required
* Valid CPR license
* Minimum of three years’ clinical outpatient experience and two years’ clinical supervision or clinical program development experience preferred
* Knowledge of EMR system
* Able to troubleshoot, keen sense for decision making and judgment; action oriented; approachable
* Team player and effective at building and fostering teamwork as well as maintain composure when dealing with conflict
* Excellent customer service skills, interpersonal and communication skills

 **What You’ll Do:**

* Responsible for meeting census goals of clinic and each clinician (office KPIs, number of patients seen). Scorecard review weekly with RCD
* Working with Human Resources, ensures compliance with all federal and state employment laws.
* Facility maintenance
* Review and approve timecards through ADP ensuring adherence to all federal and state regulations with respect to Exempt and Non-Exempt staff
* Interview/hiring (clinical, admin, aide) in collaboration with HR- take out admin
* Training and onboarding clinical staff, ongoing evaluation of performance
* Resolve performance problems on a clinic level and elevating to HR when appropriate
* Monitor staff compliance
* Follow up with patients on low net promoter scores

* Clinical support staff expense management, scheduling, interviewing, hiring/termination
* Monitor discharge policy adherence
* Monthly clinical supply ordering
* Adhere to lost patient log workflow
* Weekly call with RCD
* Weekly meeting with OM
