title: Warehouse Stand Up Rider Reach HiLo Driver
description:
**Warehouseman / Stand-up Rider Reach HiLo Driver****Responsibilities:**

* **$16 Permanent Shift:**  

	+ **Sunday-Thursday 1:00pm - 9:30pm (not including overtime)**
	+ **Sunday - Thursday 3:00pm - 11:30pm (not including overtime)**
* Operate stand up rider reach HiLo to move product from dock to rack and from rack to picking location
* Selecting full case grocery and dairy products from warehouse pick slots using pallet jacks when necessary.

 **Requirements:**

* Location:Carlstadt, New Jersey (Meadowlands area)
* 1 year stand up rider reach truck experience required
* Stand up rider reach truck certification a plus but not required
* Electric pallet jack knowledge a plus but not required
* Pre-shift safety check on equipment.
* Work in multi-temperature environment
* Meet weekly productivity standards and accuracy.
* Constant standing, walking, bending and continuously lifting up to 60 pounds.
* Must be able to read alpha and numeric codes
* No degree required but must be 18 years or older

 **Benefits:**

* Full Healthcare Benefits Package
* 401K Company match up to 5%
* Paid Sick, Personal and Vacation Days
* $16 hour Permanent Shift: Regular Overtime at time and a half

  

**Job Considerations:**

*Strength and Endurance:* Cases may weigh as much as 60 pounds and may be stored from floor level to upper rack height of 60". Extended reach requirements to the back of a 48" long pallet may be necessary due to inaccessibility to the other three sides of the pallet, as well as the lengthwise orientation of the pallet in the rack. Carry distances may range from a few feet to several yards depending on where the forklift is positioned, and whether any obstructions exist in the aisle. Repeated lifts of heavy product, handing as much as 200 cases per hour and more than 1000 cases during a standard shift make this a moderate to heavy physical work position.


**Company**


General Trading is a grocery wholesale food distributor located in **Carlstadt, New Jersey**. We are a full service grocery wholesaler and dairy wholesaler, supplier, distributor, exporter carrying over 10,000 grocery and 2,000 dairy items.

title: WAREHOUSEMAN Conductor de camión retráctil para conductor de pie
description:
$ 16 Turno permanente: Domingo a jueves 1:00pm hasta 9:30pm - consultar por otros turnos  

Responsabilidades:* Opere una carretilla elevadora de pie/Hi-Lo para mover el producto desde el muelle al estante y desde el estante al lugar de recolección.
* Seleccionar cajas completas de comestibles y productos lácteos de las ranuras de recogida del almacén utilizando transpaletas cuando sea necesario.


Beneficios:* 401K Compañía igualada hasta 5%
* Turno permanente de $ 18 horas (con diferencia de turno de verano y otoño de $ 2 por hora) y horas extras regulares a $ 27 la hora
* Plus programa de incentivos a la producción basado en el desempeño
* Período de entrenamiento pagado de 2 semanas
* Días de vacaciones, personales y por enfermedad pagados
* Médico completo
* Dental y de la vista

  

Requerimientos:* Ubicación: Carlstadt, Nueva Jersey (área de Meadowlands)
* **Se requiere 1 año de experiencia en montacargas de pie / Hi-Lo**
* Verificación de seguridad antes del turno en el equipo.
* Trabajar en un entorno de temperatura múltiple
* Cumpla con los estándares de productividad y precisión semanales.
* Constantemente de pie, caminando, agachándose y levantando continuamente hasta 60 libras.
* Debe poder leer códigos alfanuméricos
* No se requiere título, pero debe tener 18 años o más

  

Consideraciones laborales:
Resistencia y resistencia: las cajas pueden pesar hasta 60 libras y se pueden almacenar desde el nivel del piso hasta la altura del estante superior de 60 ". Es posible que se requieran requisitos de alcance extendido para la parte posterior de una paleta de 48" de largo debido a la inaccesibilidad a los otros tres lados del palet, así como la orientación longitudinal del palet en la estantería. Las distancias de transporte pueden variar desde unos pocos pies hasta varias yardas, dependiendo de dónde se coloque el montacargas y si existe alguna obstrucción en el pasillo. Las elevaciones repetidas de productos pesados, la manipulación de hasta 200 cajas por hora y más de 1000 cajas durante un turno estándar hacen de esta una posición de trabajo físico de moderada a pesada.  

 Empresa  

General Trading es un distribuidor de alimentos al por mayor de abarrotes ubicado en Carlstadt, Nueva Jersey. Somos un mayorista de comestibles de servicio completo y mayorista de lácteos, proveedor, distribuidor, exportador que transporta más de 10,000 comestibles y 2,000 productos lácteos.

title: Creative Project Manager - FIFA World Cup 2026
description:
Who We Are:
On Location is a premium experience provider, offering world class hospitality, ticketing, curated guest experiences, live event production, and travel management across sports, entertainment, and fashion. From unrivaled access for corporate clients to guests looking for fully immersive experiences at marquee events, On Location is the premier and official service provider to over 150 iconic rights holders, such as the IOC (Paris 2024, Milano Cortina 2026, LA 2028), NFL, NCAA, UFC and PGA of America, and numerous musical artists and festivals. The company also owns and operates a number of unique and exclusive experiences, transforming the most dynamic live events into a lifetime of memories. On Location is a subsidiary of Endeavor, a global sports and entertainment company.
Endeavor is a global sports and entertainment company, home to many of the world’s most dynamic and engaging storytellers, brands, live events, and experiences. The Endeavor network specializes in talent representation through entertainment agency WME; sports operations and advisory, event management, media production and distribution, and brand licensing through IMG; live event experiences and hospitality through On Location; full-service marketing through global cultural marketing agency 160over90; and sports data and technology through IMG ARENA and OpenBet. Endeavor is also the majority owner of TKO Group Holdings (NYSE: TKO), a premium sports and entertainment company comprising UFC and WWE.
The FIFA World Cup 2026 TM marketing team is seeking a motivated and highly skilled Creative Project Manager. The role will work collaboratively with a cross-functional team to manage creative requests of all sizes from start to finish across B2B and B2C workstreams.
As a key member of our in-house creative team you will ensure that all work coming through the creative department is delivered on time, at the highest level and according to FIFA’s string brand guidelines. You will manage all project details including the brief, resources, allocations, timelines, deliverables, budgets, reporting, and planning.
The ideal candidate will demonstrate experience simultaneously managing multiple projects with a wide variety of creative outputs, and deadlines across time zones in a fast-paced work environment. Your experience will include establishing creative department process, brand identity development and campaign launch experience with final creative deliverables being used across social, digital, email, website, print, OOH, radio, print, event on-site signage, and more.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES
As our creative project management lead you will:* Be the first point of contact for marketing teams when it comes to creative requests and requirements
* Be the guardian of our creative process and ensure teams are working to this process, completing and supplying clear briefs and that the process is being adhered to in a timely manner
* Clearly communicate new projects, changes, and requirements to the wider creative team and ensure everyone is informed of the latest schedule and upcoming project requirements
* Meticulously maintain and update creative schedules and timelines while managing workloads of creatives and identifying in advance where freelance resource may be required
* Support the creative director in hiring freelance resource for projects as and when required
* Coordinate, schedule and follow-up on team meetings, creative briefing sessions, creative brainstorms, and any meetings between creative & other teams required for the flawless execution of projects
* Ensure all projects are delivered on time and within budget
* Resolve any workflow conflicts which may impact project expectations


PERSON SPECIFICATION
KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE* 5-7 years of experience in the advertising or creative agency industry
* Proven experience managing the timely delivery of creative projects and deliverables
* Passion for sports and hospitality preferred with a focus on soccer/futbol
* Proven experience working with creative resources that include art directors, designers, copywriters, animators, video editors, producers, photographers, illustrators, etc.
* Proven experience working on brand, campaign, and product announcements and launches
* Proven experience planning, leading, directing, and managing various creative-driven projects simultaneously
* Basic understanding and knowledge of the sports & lifestyle global sponsorship market – understanding why brands want to partner with live events & sports properties would be extremely useful in this role;
* Mac proficiency with strong, working ability to use Keynote, PPTX, Microsoft Office, Asana, DigiDeck, Ceros, Pageproof


SKILLS & ABILITIES
The candidate should demonstrate:* Outstanding organizational skills with impeccable attention-to-detail
* Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communications skills
* The ability to balance multiple projects at once and work well under tight deadlines
* The ability to build and maintain effective relationships with a range of key internal and external stakeholders (often in different countries and time zones)
* A strong team player that is flexible dependent on business demand
* The ability to self-direct and motivate and work with minimal supervision
* Excellent time management skills, ability to work calmly under pressure while meeting deadlines
* Ability to define and redefine processes, systems, and structures to optimize workflow across the department


CIRCUMSTANCES UNIQUE TO THE ROLE* You'll usually work normal office hours, however, you may work longer hours, including evening and weekend work, when working to a campaign deadline or in the lead up to/ during an RFP/ pitch or an event.
* You may be required to travel to each event and work on-site for the duration of the event, as necessary.
* Outside of event travel there may be a requirement to travel for meetings as part of the role.


#LI-GB1
Endeavor unites and brings people together in our love of sport, culture, and entertainment. We understand this can only be accomplished when we lead with a lens of diversity, equity, and inclusion in everything we do. As a global company that drives culture, we strive to reflect the world’s diverse voices.
Endeavor is an equal opportunities employer and encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, or religion or belief.*Per local requirements and in the interest of transparency, the range shown below reflects the prevalent current hiring range for this position. Hiring pay rates are based on a number of factors, including location and may vary depending on job-related qualifications, knowledge, skills and experience. Endeavor strives to provide locally competitive rewards packages, which include base rate along with, as applicable, short- and long-term incentives, growth and developmental opportunities, and robust benefits, such as health care, retirement, vacation and other paid time off, and additional offerings.* *Hiring Range Minimum*:
$75,000 annually*Hiring Range Maximum:*
$100,000 annually

title: Group Teacher
description:
**PART-TIME GROUP TEACHER**

I’RAISE Girls & Boys International Corporation is a 501(c)(3) Non-Profit Organization in New York City. Our Afterschool Program at Storefront Academy in New York, NY is looking for 5 dedicated, committed, and enthusiastic Part-time Group Teachers to be a part of our Afterschool Program.

**Work Location:** 100% on-site in New York, NY.

**Work Schedule:** Monday to Friday, 2:20 pm to 6 pm ET

**Set rate:**  $20 per hour

**Disclaimer:** This a fund-based position

**Essential Functions:**

* Develop curriculum for class and facilitate core components specific group activities.
* Develop and implement project-based lesson plans and activities in areas of expertise that enrich academic learning.
* Develop weekly lesson plans and implement them during class.
* Write and submit lesson plans and reports to the Supervisor.
* Coordinate and plan students for school performances and shows.
* Assess student learning and skills during rehearsals.
* You are responsible for the safety and supervision of children in classes you facilitate.
* Implement social emotional learning principles in the classroom.
* Maintain two way and ongoing communication with parents, program director, group teachers, activity specialists and regular school staff as needed.
* Assist in all activities such as snack time, field trips, special events and dismissal, etc.
* Maintain daily accurate participant attendance of each class taught and written progress of each student in student files, including activity and sign-out records.
* Implement daily program standards of excellence.
* Other duties, tasks, and responsibilities assigned at any time

**Skills and Requirements:**

* High School degree with 2 + years of experience working with children
* Teaching experience preferred; *volunteer experience considered*
* Expertise in one of the following: *Music, Dance, Theater, Sports, Fitness, etc.*
* Must complete Department of Education (DOE), Department of Health (DOH) and OCFS background check requirement; *$102.50 & $25 out of pocket + TB testing cost* - fee - not covered by IRAISE due to our small budget

**Employee Benefits:**

* Sick Days, Holidays

**Physical and or mental requirement:** Possess social perceptiveness. Ability to understand the importance of discretion and confidentiality. Bending, crawling, stooping, standing, vision, lifting, and walking. Must be able to remain in a stationary position during shift, move throughout the building to access files, this role requires inspection of sites to detect safety concerns, must be able to complete tasks in a noisy environment, must be able to adhere to process protocol, must be able to apply established protocols in a timely manner. Learn new tasks, remember processes, maintain focus, complete tasks independently, make timely decisions in the context of a workflow, ability to communicate with visitors/stakeholders, ability to complete tasks in situations that have a speed or productivity quota. Occasionally ascend and descend stairs. Constantly work in indoor and outdoor weather conditions.

**Technology requirement:** Comfortable communicating via email and phone, proficient in Microsoft-suite and Google Workspace (G-suite). This job may require the use of a laptop or computer and phone.

**Disclaimer:** Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* What is your creative expertise? (For example: Dance, Art, Theater, Music, Choral, Creative Writing, Cheerleading, Sports, Fitness and such)

Work Location: In person

title: Adjunct Instructor for Holy Name School of Nursing
description:
**Description**


Holy Name is New Jersey's last remaining independent, Catholic health system, comprising a comprehensive 361-bed acute care medical center, a cancer center, medical fitness center, residential hospice, nursing school, and physician network. The system has a national reputation for providing culturally sensitive care to a diverse population, drawing patients from across the New York City region to its specialty centers and renowned doctors. Holy Name's mission to provide technologically advanced, compassionate and personalized care extends across a continuum that encompasses education, prevention, diagnosis, treatment, rehabilitation and wellness maintenance. The system is known as a high-quality, low-cost provider of extraordinary clinical care given by compassionate, highly trained physicians and staff.  

  

**A Brief Overview**  

  

Adjunct Clinical Instructor plans, implements, teaches and evaluates various courses designed to meet nursing educational needs  

  

**What you will do**

* Maintains familiarity and knowledge with current literature relative to nursing education and research
* Plans, implements, teaches and evaluates various courses designed to meet nursing educational needs
* Presents effective oral and written educational material to nursing students in a classroom setting
* Evaluates and documents the progress of students on a timely basis in attaining course knowledge and level objectives using valid and reliable assessment tools
* Verbally and in writing counsels students for any academic problems and notifies Director
* Collaborates with Hospital Nursing Management regarding orientation in the clinical area, plans, directs and provides classroom and clinical instruction
* Makes regular rounds to observe the students clinical performance and to identify learning needs
* Acts as a role model for professional nursing practice and maintains an accurate system of documentation relative to the educational experience of the students
* Consults with Holy Name Medical Center practitioners and departments to validate current practices, gather information and ensure a well rounded approach to Nursing Education
* Acts as a faculty advisor for student groups and recognizes student problems and learning difficulties and provides counseling or makes appropriate referrals.
* Participates in all activities of professional organizations related to nursing education and serves on Holy Name Medical Center or School committees
* Actively participates in school functions and on-going student recruitment programs
* Identifies needs and makes recommendations concerning budgetary expenditures or in the development of school policies and procedures. Submits recommendations to Director on a timely basis

 **Education Qualifications**

* Master's Degree in Nursing Required and
* Doctorate Preferred

 **Experience Qualifications**

* 1-3 years Two years of recent nursing experience, preferably in area of specialization Required

 **Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

* Demonstrates effective oral and written communication skills

 **Licenses and Certifications**

* RN - Registered Nurse - State Licensure and/or Compact State Licensure in the state of New Jersey Upon Hire Required

title: Product Manager, Display Ads
description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: **Mountain View, CA, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA**.### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 3 years of experience in product management or related technical role.
* 1 year of experience taking technical products from conception to launch.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g., Engineering, UX, Program Management, Sales, Marketing).

**About the job**
-----------------


At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing, so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.


In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development.


One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

  


Google Ads is helping power the open internet with the best technology that connects and creates value for people, publishers, advertisers, and Google. We’re made up of multiple teams, building Google’s Advertising products including search, display, shopping, travel and video advertising, as well as analytics. Our teams create trusted experiences between people and businesses with useful ads. We help grow businesses of all sizes from small businesses, to large brands, to YouTube creators, with effective advertiser tools that deliver measurable results. We also enable Google to engage with customers at scale.


The US base salary range for this full-time position is $122,000-$178,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.


Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.
**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Work with the cross-functional partners to ensure inventory/video/formats growth opportunities. Support both advertiser expectations and needs, as well as large growth areas in third-party inventory.
* Work with the Ads team to understand the opportunity to display inventory/video/formats landscape, trends and collaborate on powerful growth initiatives.
* Set and execute strategy that aligns with strategic direction.
* Work with cross-functional product area teams across Engineering, UX, Sales, gTech, and Go-to-Market.
* Drive cross-product area collaboration with other Ads teams.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. title: Product Manager, Privacy, Sovereignty and Compliance, Google Workspace
description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: **New York, NY, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA**.### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in product management or related technical role.
* 2 years of experience taking technical products from conception to launch.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Master's degree in a technology or business related field.
* Experience in defining and developing products to meet desired customer needs from inception to launch.
* Experience developing technical roadmaps and plans to implement solutions with communication of the roadmap to cross-functional stakeholders.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate well on different levels of abstraction, from technical to executive and from internal to external stakeholders (e.g., customers, KOFs, regulators, etc.).
* Excellent problem-solving, organizational, analytical, and influencing skills, with the ability to build productive relationships.

**About the job**
-----------------


At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing, so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.
  

  

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development.  

  

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

  


The privacy, sovereignty, and compliance team lives within Google Cloud and is part of the Google Workspace organization. Workspace, is a cloud-based productivity suite that is revolutionizing the way people communicate and collaborate with one another. The team is focused on delivering the tools that shape people’s productivity experience at work, home, and school. The privacy, sovereignty and compliance team builds products that customers/users rely on to safely and securely use Workspace.  

  

As Product Manager, you will lead the Data Regions product. Data Regions helps customers comply with regulations around the world and keeps data within the US or EU and offers advanced reporting.


Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.


The US base salary range for this full-time position is $142,000-$211,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.


Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Work on the next generation of Data Regions, defining a clear product idea and long-term plan for regionalization as default, collaborate with Workspace leaders to close existing gaps, and regionalize new areas of Workspace.
* Build knowledge in underlying systems that must be regionalized, including Search, Spam and Abuse, and Notifications, as well as in data regulations, and how regimes like GDPR and DMA impact the use of data.
* Drive a go-to-market plan, speaking with customers and regulators to make sure Google is perceived as a compliance leader.
* Build relationships with engineering, UX, legal, marketing, and numerous other teams.
* Collaborate exciting new features, including advanced reporting, alerting, and auditing for customers.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Lead Business Analyst, Business Analysis
description:
**About us**
------------

**National Grid is hiring a Lead Business Analyst, Maintenance and Inspection in our Digital Portfolio Department. This position will be based in our Melville, NY or Waltham, MA office.**


Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.


To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.


IT and Digital work in a harmonized partnership with the National Grid group of diverse energy businesses to deliver technology which revolutionizes the way we operate. As we lead the charge towards a carbon-free future, our teams are embracing disruptive changes in our industry by working with Agile methodologies and adopting Digital mindsets to drive efficiency and bring new capabilities for our internal and external customers.


Our work here is critical. National Grid moves energy to millions of homes and businesses in the UK and US and the technology we utilize to complete that task is down to us. The successful applicant for this position will be an integral contributor towards this goal and we will support your professional development as part of our multi-cultural, customer-centric global team.

**Job Purpose**
---------------


To develop and implement deliverable business plans and create strategic opportunities to drive business performance to deliver targets.

**Key Accountabilities**
------------------------


Across our Asset Maintenance and Inspection Programs, inclusive of technology & tooling, business process and data - the role will act as the voice of the business in the following key aspects:

* Business Outcomes: Defining the target business or customer outcomes for our Asset Maintenance and


Inspection capabilities. This involves understanding the desired results, goals, and value expected from the  

underlying business processes, and ensuring that the initiatives and solutions align with these outcomes.  

* Strategy and Roadmap: Developing the strategic direction and roadmap for the end-to-end maintenance and


inspections business process. This includes setting the vision, identifying key milestones, and defining the  

prioritized initiatives and features to achieve the desired outcomes including alignment with Asset  

Management and Risk Model Tooling Needs.  

* End-to-End Backlog Management: Collaborate with stakeholders, and cross-functional teams to gather


solution requirements and define the end-to-end business process backlog. Prioritize the backlog items based  

on business value, customer impact, and strategic alignment.  

* Process Improvement: Driving continuous improvement of the end-to-end maintenance and inspection


business process. This involves analyzing existing processes, identifying bottlenecks or inefficiencies, and  

implementing enhancements or optimizations to streamline workflows, reduce waste, and improve overall  

efficiency and effectiveness.  

* Data Management: Overseeing the management and governance of data within the end -to-end business


process. This includes defining data strategies, ensuring data quality and integrity, establishing data  

governance frameworks, and leveraging data insights to drive decision-making and value creation.  

* Business Change: Managing the organizational change associated with the end-to-end business process.


This involves identifying change impacts, developing change management plans, facilitating stakeholder  

engagement, and ensuring smooth adoption of new processes, technologies, or ways of working.**Qualifications**
------------------

* Knowledge of National Grid’s Maintenance and Inspection programs, process, workflows and


technology/tooling including their relationship with our Asset Investment and Risk Modelling capabilities  

* Knowledge of how data is consumed and leverage across our Maintenance and Inspection programs


process & tooling and the ability to shape and lead data quality improvement initiatives that will drive  

incremental value.  

* Ability to build and collaborate across multidisciplinary teams; business and digital/agile product teams
* Ability to make key decisions and/or influence key decision makers
* Ability to interface with the business to align on within year goals and future looking/strategic outcomes.
* Ability to interface with the business to define user tests, experiments, and value / business case


associated with solution, process and technology changes and enhancements.  

* Ability to articulate product and design needs from the business, then convey any subsequent feedback


from business to the IT product teams  

* Ability to work collaboratively with business stakeholders, product managers, and other team members to


develop a business case, test assumptions, drive user adoption, and collaborate with IT to build a product  

roadmap  

* Ability to create and present materials to senior stakeholders from different orgs
* Ability to design future-state processes and operations that address user frictions


Preferred experience:  

* Experience with Maximo and/or ESRI GIS
* Familiarity with Multiple Asset/Mandated Program work (Survey, Corrosion, Inside Service Inspections,


Meter Exchange Programs, Regulator Inspections, Valve Inspection Programs, etc)  

* Experience in the areas of Safety, Compliance, and or Regulatory programs within the National Grid


Natural Gas Service Territory,  

* Familiarity with Asset Management Practices and/or the DNV Risk Model Application a plus
* Experience with Process Teams / E2E Development / Six Sigma
* Experience in defining, testing, and refining product assumptions.
* Minimum 5-7 years’ experience working on product teams or interfacing with product teams
* At least 2 years working with (or within) utility


Mandatory requirements:  

* Bachelor’s degree in business, technology, or engineering
**More Information**
--------------------


Salary


$133,000 - $156,000 a year


This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience, expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience.

title: DEI Partner for NGV
description:
**About us**
------------

**National Grid is hiring a Lead HR DEI Partner. The position will be located in our Brooklyn, NY; Waltham, MA; or Syracuse, NY office.**

  

Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.

  

To be successful we must work collaboratively with our key stakeholders, advance and protect the Company’s reputation, anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.

**Job Purpose**
---------------


As a DEI Partner, you will be responsible for delivering expert advice, support, and leadership to our NGV Business on all DEI-related matters. You will interpret and translate the global DEI direction into actionable strategies tailored to meet specific business requirements. Collaborating closely with the Chief Diversity Officer, Chief People Officer (CPO), People team, and other stakeholders, you will coordinate and execute initiatives and projects that have a measurable impact on Business Unit and Functional DEI priorities.

**Key Accountabilities**
------------------------

* Co-lead the creation of the BU/Functional DEI plan and continual refresh, when needed
* Leverage and provide DEI insights from annual data sets (e.g Employee Engagement Survey, Leadership Index, etc.)
* Identify, develop, and deploy relevant DEI upskilling/training/initiatives in partnership with BU/Functional People Teams
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with relevant COEs to broaden the DEI reach – i.e. internal communications, property, recruitment, health and wellbeing
* Provide thought leadership/advice to CPO, People Partners, and BU/Functional Leadership on DEI related matters
**Qualifications**
------------------

* Deep subject matter expertise in DEI best practices, demonstrating a strong commitment to and passion for inclusion, equity, and diversity.
* Proven ability to drive change and implement new ways of working, showcasing innovative thinking, effective project management, and the ability to deliver multiple initiatives simultaneously.
* Possesses business knowledge and a comprehensive understanding of National Grid as a business, allowing for informed decision-making and strategic alignment.
* Adapts style and approach effectively based on the audience and stakeholders, fostering positive relationships and influencing outcomes.
* Skilled in coaching, educating, and upskilling colleagues, empowering them to embrace DEI principles and contribute to a more inclusive culture.
**More Information**
--------------------

**#LI-MR1 #LI-HYBRID**


Salary


$140k - $171k a year in Brooklyn, NY


$131k - $160k a year in Waltham, MA


$117k - $143k a year in Syracuse, NY


This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience, expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience.

 **National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.**

description:

### **Description and Requirements**

**VP, US Business - Data Officer**

 **Location(s):** New York, New York or Cary, North Carolina

**Setting:** Hybrid

**Reports to:** SVP Chief Data Officer

  

MetLife, through its subsidiaries and affiliates, is one of the world’s leading financial services companies, providing insurance, annuities, employee benefits and asset management to individual and institutional customers. We’re united by our purpose to help our customers and each other create a confident future; we’re guided by empathy; and we’re inspired by each other to make a difference in the lives of our coworkers, customers, communities, and the world at large. At MetLife, it’s #AllTogetherPossible. Join us!

 **The Opportunity**

  

As **US Business - Data Officer**, this role has full responsibility and accountability for leading the ideation and development of actionable, high impact, data and analytics solutions in support of MetLife’s US Business strategy. The work will deliver data driven decisions across all critical business functions such as customer acquisitions, loyalty, retention, profitability, risk management, innovation, operations and more.


The role involves creating and delivering a Data Roadmap that aligns with the US Business goals, collaborating with various stakeholders and partners, identifying new and novel uses for data and analytics, ensuring the prioritization and delivery of data capabilities, and driving operational excellence and efficiency.

 **How You’ll Help Us Build a Confident Future (Key Responsibilities)**

* Develop and deliver a Data Roadmap integrated with the US Business (USB) strategy.
* Work collaboratively with US lines of businesses, US Technology, Infrastructure, along with vendor partners, to translate the Data Roadmap into projects and programs.
* Serve as “business to data” translator and orchestrator, ensuring the Data Roadmap is effectively implemented within each key line of business to enable business outcomes.
* Identify new and novel uses for data and analytics across supported lines of business to create/enable growth, process optimization, and customer insight.
* Envision new data solutions and identification of where existing solutions can be expanded or scaled to meet the growing needs of our customers and business partners.
* Engage with customers to understand needs and requirements, then effectively communicate those needs and requirements across Data and Analytics (DnA) organization
* Work directly with USB and DnA leaders to prioritize the backlog and ensure design and delivery of innovative data and analytics solutions.
* Ensure priorities are appropriately set and teams are engaged to deliver committed DnA capabilities.
* Analyze key trends in the business units and provide actionable recommendations to how data can help solve problems, increase efficiencies, and create growth opportunities.
* Enhance data acumen and acceptance within lines of business, leading to the creation of self-service functions including but not limited to Business Intelligence, Analytics.
* Establish baselines and build key performance measures to track progress against the data roadmaps, course correcting as necessary to achieve the outcomes desired.
* Drive operational excellence and consistency, through the identification and enablement of opportunity areas that create efficiency, removing obstacles and/or creating improved processes and approaches to enhance the customer experience.
* Develop relationship with senior business and technology leaders, gaining consensus and driving to accomplish the goals, with strong interpersonal, conflict resolution and negotiation skills.
* Support business teams’ interaction to identify opportunities, improvements and escalate issues along the execution of the roadmap. Help with the identification of issues, provide guidance, and follow through resolution.

 **What You Need to Succeed (Required Qualifications)**

* 15 years of experience and knowledge in data and analytics tools and strategies including but not limited to ML, modeling, data management and quality, governance, BI, and visualization are required.
* Proven ability to navigate complex stakeholders across all levels of the organization and cultivate strong partnerships.
* Thoughtful leadership skills and experience in translating greenfield ideas into productionized solutions.
* Ability to influence and communicate the organizations direction and ensure results are achieved.

  


  

*The salary range for applicants for this position is $209,000 - $278,700 - This role is also eligible for annual short-term incentive compensation and stock-based long-term incentives..*
**Benefits We Offer**  

Our U.S. benefits address holistic well-being with programs for physical and mental health, financial wellness, and support for families. We offer a comprehensive health plan that includes medical/prescription drug and vision, dental insurance, and no-cost short- and long-term disability. We also provide company-paid life insurance and legal services, a retirement pension funded entirely by MetLife and 401(k) with employer matching, group discounts on voluntary insurance products including auto and home, pet, critical illness, hospital indemnity, and accident insurance, as well as Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and digital mental health programs, parental leave, volunteer time off, tuition assistance and much more!
**About MetLife**  

*Recognized on Fortune magazine's list of the 2023 "World's Most Admired Companies" as well as the 2023 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For ®, MetLife*, through its subsidiaries and affiliates, is one of the world’s leading financial services companies; providing insurance, annuities, employee benefits and asset management to individual and institutional customers. With operations in more than 40 markets, we hold leading positions in the United States, Latin America, Asia, Europe, and the Middle East.  

  

Our purpose is simple - to help our colleagues, customers, communities, and the world at large create a more confident future. United by purpose and guided by empathy, we’re inspired to transform the next century in financial services. At MetLife, it’s #AllTogetherPossible. Join us!
*Equal Employment Opportunity/Disability/Veterans*  

*If you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email us at accommodations@metlife.com. This information will be held in confidence and used only to determine an appropriate accommodation for the application process.*  

  

*MetLife maintains a drug-free workplace.*
$209,000 - $278,700 - This role is also eligible for annual short-term incentive compensation and stock-based long-term incentives.

title: Associate Veterinarian - General Practice in the Bronx, NY
description:
***$25,000 Signing Bonus***

 **Armory Dog & Cat Hospital**

**A Guardian Veterinary Practice**

**Bronx, NY**

  

Guardian Veterinary is a progressively evolving, privately owned and operated emergency and specialty small animal hospital with our flagship location in picturesque Brewster, NY. Situated an hour north of Manhattan, Guardian Veterinary offers up both wide open spaces for hiking and apple picking, as well as the hustle and bustle of NYC at your fingertips. Our mission is to provide “Exceptional Care. Without Exception.” Our prodigious team operates in a state of the art 30,000 square foot fully renovated facility. We are one of the few to offer the best surgical suites and are a premier neurology center in New York. Our CEO, Dr. Jason Berg is board certified in Neurology and Internal Medicine. He founded Guardian Veterinary in 2018 committed to providing the best care possible to all our clients. We have a 24/7 Emergency Room in our Brewster, NY location and in addition we provide Neurology, Internal Medicine, Critical Care, Surgery, Ophthalmology, Cardiology, Oncology, Sports Medicine, Rehabilitation, Blood Bank and diagnostic imaging and laboratory services. Since our founding, Guardian Veterinary has grown to include locations in Middletown, NY, for ER Services, overnight and weekends/holidays as well as a General Practice in the Bronx, NY. We are ahead of the curve with current and new advancements in the veterinary world and keep our gaze on the evolving and exciting veterinary horizon.


Armory Dog and Cat Hospital is a 35-year-old practice with an incredible growth rate. If you are searching for a place where you can look forward to going in to work every day, and that will reward hard work and dedication then look no further. Our mission is to offer the highest level of health care while administering it in as close to a fear-free environment as possible. We provide an upbeat and enjoyable work environment for our staff which contributes to the patients we see and have a better chance at a pleasant experience as well. Everything we do is patient-focused which has resulted in many happy clients too, again contributing to a pleasant work environment. We do not force time limits on exams and keep our pricing reasonable so fewer animals go without the health care they need.

  

 The culture of Guardian Veterinary is team oriented and is geared to our team members being who they are with our full support. Guardian Veterinary has growth and learning opportunities in the air. We support your growth by investing in you and your future by providing CE trainings we offered monthly; listening to our team, to constantly work to better our team; career advancement opportunities as Guardian Veterinary grows; mentorship & training; ability to learn from notable talented professionals in the field; 401k options; group whole life insurance; exceptional benefits (health, vision and dental); PTO; Maternity & Paternity leave; mental health services at no cost and much more…..with a whole lot of heart.


Armory Dog & Cat Hospital is offering full-time or part-time Veterinarian openings for our General Practice in the Bronx, NY. Armory is willing to train if you are a recent graduate, but if you have experience, we will pay accordingly. We work with cats and dogs. We offer general services and handle most surgical procedures like foreign body obstruction, mass removals, spay/neuter, cystotomy and dentals.


We pay bi-weekly with direct deposit, offer medical benefits with dental/vision included, give bonuses, supply meals on busy days, we also offer many discounts on professional services, and assist our staff in every way we can with furthering and expanding their knowledge and skill-sets.

 **\\*\\*Must have their own reliable transportation\\*\\***

**\\*\\*Compensation is commensurate to experience\\*\\***

**\\*\\*Location is in The Bronx, NY\\*\\***

**\\*\\*$125,000 - $150,000 per year.** **\\*\\*Compensation to commensurate with experience\\*\\***


What you will bring to this role:

* Graduate from a Veterinary Medicine program and a love of animals
* The desire to continually learn, train and grow
* Some General Practice experience preferred, but not required. New graduates welcome.
* Must to open to working 5 days a week for full-time, Monday through Friday from 9am to 6pm, with alternating Saturdays, 9:30am to 5pm.

  

Why you will love Armory Dog & Cat Hospital:

* Profit Sharing
* Unique culture that focuses on strong positive relationships within the work place
* Opportunity to train and learn
* State of the art technology
* Assistance with relocation
* Generous salaries
* Bi-weekly pay
* Opportunity to earn CE credit’s monthly
* Exceptional benefits (health, vision and dental)
* Sponsorship available for international professionals
* Generous discount on employee pet boarding & pet care
* Free meals provided to the staff on busy days
* Guardian outings
* Pet blood donor perks
* Free pet bereavement services for staff
* Free mental health services for staff

  

Who we are:


Contact us today to find out about a career with Armory Dog & Cat Hospital!

title: Coordinator of Student Engagement for Programming & Activities
description:
We are seeking a Coordinator of Student Engagement for Programming and Activities who will report to the Assistant Dean for Student Engagement within the Center for Student Engagement, the Coordinator is responsible for supervising the development and administration of student activities, community services initiatives, civic engagement efforts, training and advising of the student government association (SGA) and serves as an administrative advisor to all clubs/registered student organizations.

**Example of Duties:**

* Plan, organize, evaluate, and coordinate a comprehensive student activities program for the ever-evolving community college student.
* Serve as the primary advisor for the SGA.
* Supervise Center for Student Engagement part time staff.
* Assist with inquiries from faculty, staff, students, and community members related to all student activities processes and operations.
* Review, coordinate and approve all student clubs’ activities and provide training and support for club advisors.
* Identify vendors and negotiate the best possible contract for student related events under the guidance of the Assistant Dean for Student Engagement.
* Assist the Assistant Dean for Student Engagement with all fiscal planning and management for student engagement, including operations and personnel matters.
* Prepare and manage the annual student activities budget.
* Serve as a competent academic advisor to special populations such as SGA student leaders and club/registered student organization leaders.
* Research, plan, and coordinate internal and external community services opportunities for PCCC students.
* Plan, organize, and coordinate civic engagement experiences to prepare PCCC students to engage with civic/democratic processes in their community.
* Explore external funding/grant opportunities to supplement institutional funding of Programming & Activities initiatives.
* Collaborate with the Director of Student Engagement for Athletics & Recreation to provide recreational activities, programs, and support for PCCC students.
* Support Commencement activities in collaboration with the Office of Student Affairs.
* Monitor, analyze and evaluate current scope of services offered in the Center for Student Engagement.
* Plan, implement and coordinate new programs under the supervision of the Assistant Dean for Student Engagement and in coordination with other divisional and college-wide efforts.
* Work to promote the model of one campus, three locations as it relates to the student engagement experience.
* Serve as Student Engagement representative for division-wide and college-wide initiatives.
* Participates in professional organizations and collaborates with state affinity groups and regional organizations to pursue and enhance student development and enrollment initiatives.
* Perform related duties as required.


**Qualifications**:

* Master's degree in student development, student personnel services, education, or related field. (Required)
* At least two years of progressive leadership and administrative work experience in student activities. (Required)
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. (Required)
* Demonstrated proficiency with student information systems and Microsoft Office 365 applications. (Required)
* Ability to work some evenings and weekends as assigned. (Required)
* Knowledge and experience in student development theories, budgets, and program development. (Required)
* Prior work experience in higher education, preferably at a community college. (Preferred)
* Demonstrated knowledge and experience in using varied social media platforms in a professional manner. (Preferred)
* Bilingual. (Preferred)


The completion of a background check will be required for the selected candidate.
company_description: One of the most diverse colleges in the state, PCCC enrolls over 13,000 students in both traditional and online programs.

title: Branch Manager
company: Industrial and Commerce Bank Of China USA NA
description:
**Job Title:** Branch Manager

**Department**: Consumer Banking - Brooklyn Branch

**Classification:** Exempt

**Reports to:** Head of Consumer Banking

 **Summary/Objective:**


Manage Bank Branch by performing the following duties personally or through subordinate supervisors.

 **Essential Functions**: include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

* Oversee the flow of cash and financial instruments in accordance with company policy.
* Assess risk of all financial transactions executed by organization personnel.
* Collect data to analyze the present and future financial status of the organization.
* Implement institution's policies, procedures, and practices.
* Contact customers and business, community, and civic organizations to promote goodwill and generate new business.
* Compile and report financial data as required by organization and government regulations.

 **Competencies:**

* To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
* Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service; Responds to requests for service and assistance.
* Interpersonal Skills - Maintains confidentiality.
* Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations.
* Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively.
* Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Contributes to building a positive team spirit.


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 **Supervisory Responsibilities:**


Manage subordinate supervisors who supervise employees in the Branch. Responsible for the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of these units. Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.

 **Physical Demands:**


This is largely a sedentary role, requiring use of typical office equipment such as a computer, laptop and cell phone. Most work is completed in an office environment. Walking around the office and talking to employees and supervisors is required.

 **Travel Requirements:**


Traveling is required based on the business needs. Commutes pertaining to, but not limited to, visitations to clients, property site visits, attendance of seminars or marketing events, and more.

 **Required Education and Experience:**


Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university; or five to seven years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.


Language/Communication Skills

 **Language/Communication Skills**


Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization. Fluency in Cantonese and/or Mandarin.

title: Echo Tech
description:
**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a skilled Echo Technician/Sonographer to join our team. The ideal candidate will perform diagnostic ultrasound examinations for patients under the supervision of physicians. This role requires proficiency in operating ultrasound equipment to capture images and conduct examinations related to cardiac anatomy and function.

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform echocardiogram procedures and vascular ultrasound examinations as prescribed by physicians.
* Operate ultrasound equipment to obtain diagnostic images and conduct tests for cardiovascular conditions.
* Assist physicians in interpreting diagnostic images and test results.
* Maintain patient records, documentation, and reports of procedures performed.
* Ensure compliance with safety protocols and quality assurance standards in ultrasound imaging.
* Provide patient education and ensure patient comfort during procedures.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum of 1 year experience as a Registered Echo Technician/Sonographer.
* Registered Diagnostics Cardiac Sonographer (RDCS) certification issued by the American Registry for Diagnostic Medical Sonography (ARDMS) required.
* Basic Life Support (BLS) certification and experience with stress testing preferred.
* Proficient in operating ultrasound equipment and conducting diagnostic procedures.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills to interact effectively with patients and medical staff.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced healthcare environment.

title: Client Care Coordinator - Soundview
description:
**Client Care Coordinator**


We are excited to invite a passionate and experienced **Client Care Coordinator** to join our team! Homes for the Homeless (HFH) is searching for an experienced Client Care Coordinator for our Families w/ Children facility in the Soundview area of the Bronx. As the Client Care Coordinator, you will play a pivotal role in our organization by providing mental health and related services for homeless families. Our ideal candidate will enhance existing services to include a thorough assessment of families’ long-term goals at intake and collaborate with the case management staff to set achievable goals and establish linkages within the community to ensure the family’s success. Join us and be a part of an organization that values your contribution and cares deeply for the community we serve.

 **ABOUT HOMES FOR THE HOMELESS, INC.**


Homes for the Homeless operates shelters for families experiencing homelessness in NYC. Our family residences are more than just a place to sleep. Families can make the most of their stay through accessing an array of onsite programs. Many of these programs are also available to people living in the local community. Our goal is to have a positive impact so families can thrive long after they leave our shelters.

 **ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Complete a comprehensive bio-psychosocial assessment with each family to understand strengths and service needs.
* Monitor, lead and coordinate social service and counseling support including appropriate and timely interventions.
* Ensure focus on effective social services delivery to clients, including integration of models and best practices (such as trauma informed and family centered care)
* Monitor and document client progress toward service plan goals.
* Ensure that families are receiving full support in shelter and, when necessary, refer families for counseling or other services.
* Supports the Family Services department by working alongside the Case Manager and supporting staff when dealing with challenging clients.
* Improve linkages to mental health, education, and community-based services.
* Strengthen the overall permanency outcomes for families with children in shelter.
* Manage record keeping, data collection, and evaluation on the effectiveness of services for families.
* Assists with unit inspections when needed.
* Support the Family Services department by conducting trainings.
* Promote and model best practices for Family Services staff

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Must have a master’s degree in Social Work or Mental Health Counseling
* Applicants must hold an LMSW (Licensed Master Social Worker) **or** LMHC (Licensed Master Health Counselor) in the state of New York.
* Familiarity with substance use disorders and addiction treatment services, domestic violence, child abuse and maltreatment, trauma, and mental health conditions
* Sensitivity and awareness of working with homeless and vulnerable populations is a plus
* Bilingual is a plus

 **COMPENSATION/EEO:**  

In order to attract and retain a high-performance workforce, Homes for the Homeless offers a dynamic and rewarding work environment, with a focus on ensuring an appropriate work-life balance. In addition to a competitive salary, we provide excellent benefits including comprehensive health insurance (including medical, dental, and vision), an employer-funded 403(b) retirement plan, commuter benefits, life insurance, Work/Life Assistance Program, 10 sick days, 3 personal days, and 12 paid holidays.


Homes for the Homeless is committed to promoting an inclusive organizational environment of dignity and respect. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO) committed to equal treatment, and prohibit any form of discrimination or harassment based on age, race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), gender (including gender identity and gender expression), disability, predisposing genetic characteristics, marital status, arrest or conviction, domestic violence victim status, familial status, or any other basis that would be in violation of any applicable federal, state, or local law.

**SALARY**


$70,000

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Description:
**Summary**


The Maintenance Technician is responsible for performing and assisting with property maintenance and repairs.

**Essential Functions**

* Maintain the physical functionality and safety of the facility including, but not limited to, guest rooms, meeting rooms and lobby area.
* Respond to guest calls and team member work orders in a timely, friendly and efficient manner to assess and repair non-functioning machinery and/or equipment.
* Perform a variety of repair and maintenance tasks including, but not limited to carpentry, plumbing, electrical work, painting, HVAC work and masonry.
* Conduct inspections for preventive maintenance needs.
* Record and report completed repairs and items that require further attention.
* Maintain the physical condition of the hotel according to established operating and safety standards, ensuring that service requests and repairs are made correctly and in a timely manner.
* Check on all guest room electrical appliances and circuits, including refrigeration controls, television sets, and lighting systems, making repairs where necessary.
* Provide guest room service/repair status to Front Desk, General Manager, and Executive Housekeeper.
* Perform general carpentry, tiling, painting and wall surface repairs.
* Respond in a timely, courteous manner to guest questions, complaints, or requests.
* Properly maintains tools, workspaces, and equipment.
* Complete preventive maintenance checklists and other maintenance records.


Requirements:
**Required Skills & Experience**

* General maintenance experience required.
* Experience in hotel maintenance preferred.
* Attention to detail.
* Verbal and written communication skills.

**Work Environment**


This job operates in an indoor hotel environment and outside. This job continuously uses tools and safety equipment. This job is occasionally exposed to fumes, gases, odors, dust, and biohazards.

**Physical Demands**


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is continuously required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to handle or feel objects, supplies or equipment; reach with hands and arms overhead and below the knees including bending, twisting, pulling and stooping; climb stairs; communicate or listen. The employee must occasionally lift, carry, push, pull or place products and supplies, up to 50 pounds.

**Other Duties**


Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
**Ambulatory Center for Endoscopy (ACE) a GI Ambulatory Surgical Center in North Bergen, NJ, has an exciting opportunity for a full-time Registered Nurse to join the team!**

**What makes us awesome:**

*Perks and benefits offered to eligible employees*

* No evening, on-call or holiday work hours
* Paid Time Off - Vacation, Sick, Holidays, Bereavement, Jury, and Voting
* High quality, cost effective Medical, Dental, Vison, and Prescription benefits

**What you will be working on:**

**The duties and responsibilities of the Registered Nurse include, but are not limited to:**

**Admitting Role**

* Identifies self to patient and family and assures the correct identity of patient and procedure to be performed.
* Checks patient’s vital signs and does pre-procedure assessment.
* Able to select correct IV catheter and insert IV catheter within two attempts.
* Offers emotional support to patients.
* Demonstrates knowledge of procedures.
* Documents and communicates any specific patient concerns.

**Procedure Room Role**

* Assures the correct identity of the patient and procedure to be performed.
* Correct documentation of procedure and medications.
* Knowledge of medications and the ability to administer through various routes.
* Able to utilize all equipment to monitor patient.
* Offers emotional support to patient during the procedure.
* Appropriate use of personal protective equipment.
* Keeps physicians aware of patient’s condition during procedures.
* Accurately documents specimens.
* Knows emergency protocol.
* If not previously completed, can insert IV catheter with no more than 2 sticks.
* Chooses appropriate site for I.V. insertion.
* Accurately and completely documents I.V. insertion information.

**Recovery Role**

* Educates patients on surgical procedures and post op care prior to discharge.
* Implements the plan of care by maintaining constant and vigilant patient care by ensuring patient safety and needs.
* Reassess patients as needed and appropriately revise the plan of care.
* Correctly administer prescribed treatment.
* Provide emotional support to patients and their families.
* Keep accurate documentation of patient's treatment, activity and condition, as well as patient's response to medical and nursing interventions.
* Act rapidly and effectively during an emergency situation, managing self, patients, families and other employees.
* Use clinical judgment in delegating assignments to medical assistants in providing patient care, and ensuring that assignments are completed.
* Participates in quality improvement activities.

**What you’ll know:**

* A successful applicant must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.
* GI experience preferred, preferably in an ASC or GI Suite
* Current NJ RN license
* Bilingual English/Spanish preffered
* BCLS certification

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) - Basking Ridge
description:
Description:
**About Us:**


The mission of Our House, Inc. is to provide healthy, stimulating and inclusive environments for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities through community residences, employment services, innovative day programs, social opportunities and related support services designed to help them achieve their full potential for living meaningful and productive lives.

**Description:**


Direct Support Professionals (DSP) support individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities with activities of daily living, community inclusion and in learning independent living skills in group homes or apartments.

**Job Type**

* Full-Time and Part-time shifts available.

**Current Shifts Available:**

* 3pm-11pm
* **Weekend:** 7am-3pm or 8am-3pm depending on specific site
* **Awake Overnight:** 11pm-7am or 11pm-9am depending on specific site

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent required
* Valid New Jersey driver's license in good standing
* Must attend and pass and maintain agency provided (Paid) trainings


Requirements:
**Job Responsibilities:**

* Support learning and gaining independent living skill in areas such as but not limited to nutrition, hygiene, money management, and social skills
* Assist with personal care, including hygiene and medical needs
* Ensure residents' safety and well-being
* Administer and document medications
* Transport residents to appointments and activities
* Support residents in community integration
* Lift/Force Requirement Weight Constant 10 lbs Frequent 25 lbs Occasional 50 lbs
* Demonstrate empathy and respect towards residents
* Participate in staff meetings and training
* Advocate for residents' rights and needs
* Maintain accurate documentation
* While on shift must be comfortable driving agency vehicles for community activities and transportation to medical & planned appointments.

**Physical/Mental Demands:**

* Must ensure safety
* Physical ability to assist residents with mobility and personal care
* Good judgment and problem-solving skills
* Able to work and think independently

**Salary Description**


$18.50-$19.50 per hour depending on specific site

**Equal Opportunity Employer Statement**


Our House Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees are valued and respected. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to these factors.


We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences. If you require a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact us at HRdepartment@ourhousenj.org.
